emails.subject: RunPod Credits for AI Hack
emails.snippet: Hey Mihri! As sponsors of AI Hack, we're excited to give you $250 in RunPod credits. RunPod is a cloud provider for AI. We make it easy to spin up GPU instances and scale inference on your models.
emails.body:
Hey Mihri!

As sponsors of AI Hack, we’re excited to give you $250 in RunPod
<runpod.io/?utm_source=hackathon&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ai-hack-april-07-2024>
credits.

RunPod is a cloud provider for AI. We make it easy to *spin up GPU
instances* and scale inference on your models.

To redeem your credits, first create an account
<runpod.io/?utm_source=hackathon&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ai-hack-april-07-2024>,
then click this link
<https://www.runpod.io/console/user/billing?code=ye8fa4n6r1s1fes58jfu&utm_source=hackathon&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ai-hack-april-07-2024>
to redeem them.

If you run into any issues, feel free to join our community Discord
<https://discord.gg/J7VtscKBrQ>, or you can send send me an email or
message on Discord @polar.blue :)

Best,
Haris

emails.subject: Mostly Multiples: 4/7 Benchmarks
emails.body:
View this post on the web at https://www.mostlymetrics.com/p/mostly-multiples-47-benchmarks

My goal is to create the best valuation and performance benchmarks specifically for tech operators. If you are in Finance, Strategy, or Operations, this will help you translate what the outside world values to your target operating model.
The “Next Buyer” Angle to Valuation
Last week [ https://substack.com/redirect/de4cc826-555c-4a2a-a207-9633f52aaa93?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] we talked about how venture fund returns typically follow a power law (e.g., 80% of the returns are generated by 20% of the investments).
As a rule of thumb, investors will often want to see a scenario where any given company could theoretically return the fund 1x.
To take that a step further… Investors are not only doing the math on what they have to believe you can do, but what the person who buys from them will need to think you can do.
This is called the Next Buyer sanity check.
A growth stage investor explained to me:
“You also have to think what the next person has to believe to buy it. 
So if you believe it can go from $100M to $300M, you can’t stop there - you also have to believe that someone else will believe it can go from $300M to $600M so they can get their 3x return, too. 
Otherwise you don’t have an exit.”
Remember - when a VC sizes you up, they’re not only doing the math on their way in and out - they’re also doing it for the next guy.
Mostly metrics is a reader-supported publication. To receive new posts and support my work, consider becoming a free or paid subscriber.
Figures for each index are measured at the Median
Average, Median, and Top 10 Median are measured across the entire data set, where n = 152
All margins are non-gaap
SMB is defined as average customer size below $100K in annual revenue
Enterprise is defined as average customer size above $100K in annual revenue
You can find the list of companies within each index here [ https://substack.com/redirect/0048fb07-8e8c-49bd-a912-69e194e5b8d2?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]. 
All definitions and formulas can be found here [ https://substack.com/redirect/7f0e0fea-8c3b-4390-b837-e9473d6a6a03?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]. 
If you’d like the specific company level performance benchmarks used in these reports visit Virtua Research [ https://substack.com/redirect/8f1289e8-ea9a-4be9-bdb4-efecb517f32a?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]. 
Revenue Multiples
Revenue multiples are a shortcut to compare valuations across the technology landscape, where companies may not yet be profitable. The most standard timeframe for revenue multiple comparison is on a “Next Twelve Months” (NTM Revenue) basis.
NTM is a generous cut, as it gives a company “credit” for a full “rolling” future year. It also puts all companies on equal footing, regardless of their fiscal year end and quarterly seasonality.
However, not all technology verticals or monetization strategies receive the same “credit” on their forward revenue, which operators should be aware of when they create comp sets for their own companies. That is why I break them out as separate “indexes”.
Reasons may include: 
Recurring mix of revenue 
Stickiness of revenue
Average contract size
Cost of revenue delivery
Criticality of solution
Total Addressable Market potential
From a macro perspective, multiples trend higher in low interest environments, and vice versa.
Multiples shown are calculated by taking the Enterprise Value / NTM revenue.
Enterprise Value is calculated as: Market Capitalization + Total Debt - Cash
Market Cap fluctuates with share price day to day, while Total Debt and Cash are taken from the most recent quarterly financial statements available. That’s why we share this report each week - to keep up with changes in the stock market, and to update for quarterly earnings reports when they drop.
Historically, a 10x NTM Revenue multiple has been viewed as a “premium” valuation reserved for the best of the best companies.
Efficiency Benchmarks
Companies who can do more with less tend to earn higher valuations.
Three of the most common, and consistently publicly available, metrics to measure efficiency include:
CAC Payback Period: How many months does it take to recoup the cost of acquiring a customer?
CAC Ratio is calculated as: (∆TTM Sales * Gross Profit Margin) / TTM S&M
CAC Payback Period is calculated as: (1 / CAC ratio) * 12
Note: Some may measure CAC Payback using the change in last quarter’s revenue x 4, but I believe this overstates a company’s progress if they are growing fast, and the output can be volatile due to quarterly sales seasonality. That’s why I look at it on a Trailing Twelve Month Basis.
Rule of 40: How does a company balance topline growth with bottom line efficiency? It’s the sum of the company’s revenue growth rate and free cash flow margin. Netting the two should get you above 40 to pass the test.
Rule of 40 is calculated as: Total Revenue Growth YoY % + Non Gaap Operating Profit Margin %
Non Gaap Free Cash Flow is calculated as: Net cash provided by operating activities, minus capital expenditures and minus capitalized software development costs.
Revenue per Employee: On a per head basis, how much in sales does the company generate each year? The rule of thumb is public companies should be doing north of $450k per employee at scale. This is simple division. And I believe it cuts through all the noise - there’s nowhere to hide.
Revenue per Employee is calculated as: (TTM Revenue / Total Current Employees)
A few other notes on efficiency metrics: 
Net Dollar Retention is another great measure of efficiency, but many companies have stopped quoting it as an exact number, choosing instead to disclose if it’s above or below a threshold once a year. It’s also uncommon for marketplaces and fintechs to report it at all.
Most public companies don’t report net new ARR, and not all revenue is “recurring”, so I’m using annual change in TTM revenue timeframes as a proxy in my calculations. I admit this is a “stricter” view, as it is measuring change in net revenue, rather than gross revenue additions pre-churn.
A word from our sponsor Blue Rocket
Revenue flat-lining? Has profitability taken on a new urgency since the capital markets have changed?
Small, skillful pricing changes make dramatic impacts on margins and revenue. 
The journey to price optimization is complex, but you don't have to navigate it alone. Blue Rocket teams up with finance, product and sales to quickly improve profit outlooks.
Our edge? BlueRocket's teams are all partner-level, seasoned professionals who have all operated businesses. We’re not just advisors; we're hands-on partners, ready to operationalize strategies with you.
Seeking a pricing revolution?
Operating Expenditures
Decreasing your OPEX relative to revenue demonstrates Operating Leverage, and leaves more dollars to drop to the bottom line, as companies strive to achieve +25% profitability at scale. 
The three most common buckets companies put their operating costs into are:
Sales & Marketing: Sales and Marketing employees, advertising, demand gen, events, conferences, tools
Research & Development: Product and Engineering employees, development expenses, tools
General & Administrative: Finance, HR, and IT employees… and everything else. Or as I like to call myself “Strategic Backoffice Overhead”
All of these are taken on a non Gaap basis and therefore exclude stock based comp, a non cash expense. SBC is still an important figure to track for total comp and dilution purposes, though. 
All benchmarking data provided by Virtua Research [ https://substack.com/redirect/8f1289e8-ea9a-4be9-bdb4-efecb517f32a?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]. 
For assistance with your own benchmarking and equity research needs, contact cventi@virtuaresearch.com [ mailto:cventi@virtuaresearch.com ]. 
Tell him CJ sent you; he'll hook you up!"

Unsubscribe https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubW9zdGx5bWV0cmljcy5jb20vYWN0aW9uL2Rpc2FibGVfZW1haWw_.Cw70TUYKJObpYL3ANVpumPImjmCr7PWyJrfCpP1y7e0?

emails.subject: StartUp Founders: Values Are The Worst
emails.snippet: If your app crashes overnight, what's your move? Transparency with every customer, or hope it slides under the radar? ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
emails.body:
If your app crashes overnight, what’s your move?
Transparency with every customer, or hope it slides under the
radar?

(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/xmum3px6e6f6hr0qm36igu03owzll/m2h7h5h8wmd9m3fm/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuc2lkZWJhci5jb20vc3RhcnR1cHRvc2NhbGV1cC8_dXRtX3NvdXJjZT1zdGFydHVwdG9zY2FsZXVwJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249d2FpdGxpc3QmdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9MiZsY3RnPXEzMHY2d3p3
)
Hey Mihri,

If your app crashes overnight, what’s your move? Transparency
with every customer, or hope it slides under the radar? Welcome
to core values. Urgh... (𝕏 Tweet (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/xmum3px6e6f6hr0qm36igu03owzll/e0hph7h05q8eq4i8/aHR0cHM6Ly9jdHQuZWMvMjNmNG4_bGN0Zz1xMzB2Nnd6dw==
))

This isn't just about your tech stack's resilience; it's a litmus
test for those values. (Amazon: Leadership Principle - Earn
Trust)

TLDR; Believing culture, values, and principles are the outcomes
of growth is a rookie (and arrogant) mistake. They are the
foundation of it. (Workbook (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/xmum3px6e6f6hr0qm36igu03owzll/owhkhqhr5g2ngxuv/aHR0cHM6Ly9zdGFydHVwdG9zY2FsZXVwLmNvbS9tb2R1bGUyLjQvP2xjdGc9cTMwdjZ3enc=
))

(

)

).

LAST WEEKS FRAMEWORK:

2.3 Your Atomic ICP (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/xmum3px6e6f6hr0qm36igu03owzll/6qheh8h70nmwngho/aHR0cHM6Ly9zdGFydHVwdG9zY2FsZXVwLmNvbS9tb2R1bGUyLjMvP2xjdGc9cTMwdjZ3enc=
) aka Looking For Nemo

LETS GET INTO IT:

I get it, committing to values seems antithetical to us StartUp
pirates, the “whatever it takes” crew, the "wing it till you win
it" team, the hackers, the dreamers, the fighters. I hear you.
But remember, even pirates set sail with a code. (Amazon: Be
Frugal)

It seems absurd when you're fighting to survive I'm out here
talking about culture? Here's the epic irony: the very reasons
you might brush this off (speed, survival, agility) are precisely
why these principles are critical. They're what enable the growth
and velocity, especially when navigating the unknown (Amazon:
Ownership).

Even worse, you're tasked with etching these values in stone,
leaving no room to alter them with every shift in direction
(intentional or not). (Amazon: Commit)

Even worse, it demands that you think deeply about the kind of
leader you want to be and the company you are building. (Amazon:
Be Right, Often)

Even worse, this isn’t something you can put off until post MVP
release. Your principles are the bedrock upon which everything
else stands. They shape everything, even the way you code
(Amazon: Insist on the Highest Standards).

Learn from the titans: Amazon, PWC, and Walmart. This workbook (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/xmum3px6e6f6hr0qm36igu03owzll/owhkhqhr5g2ngxuv/aHR0cHM6Ly9zdGFydHVwdG9zY2FsZXVwLmNvbS9tb2R1bGUyLjQvP2xjdGc9cTMwdjZ3enc=
) includes their principles and asks some challenging questions
to help you create your own.

(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/xmum3px6e6f6hr0qm36igu03owzll/owhkhqhr5g2ngxuv/aHR0cHM6Ly9zdGFydHVwdG9zY2FsZXVwLmNvbS9tb2R1bGUyLjQvP2xjdGc9cTMwdjZ3enc=
)
-->Download (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/xmum3px6e6f6hr0qm36igu03owzll/owhkhqhr5g2ngxuv/aHR0cHM6Ly9zdGFydHVwdG9zY2FsZXVwLmNvbS9tb2R1bGUyLjQvP2xjdGc9cTMwdjZ3enc=
)
Download ( https://startuptoscaleup.com/module2.4/ )Having,
knowing, and choosing when to lean into or step back from these
values defines your path. They are your company’s ethical OKRs.

When the idea of dedicating precious bandwidth to defining values
seems utterly impractical, remember: you don’t just have the
right to define values; you have the responsibility. It's your
values that provide direction during pivots, enhance teamwork and
fundamentally unify your efforts towards accelerated growth
(Amazon: Learn and Be Curious).

It's easy to misconstrue startup culture as the sum of your Slack
emojis and late-night hackathons. But your culture and by
extension, your success is directly tied to the leadership
principles you embody and enforce. Whether it's making tough
calls with integrity or fostering innovation and customer
obsession, these are your values (Amazon: Think Big).

Happy leading… As always, you are welcome to grab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/xmum3px6e6f6hr0qm36igu03owzll/58hvh7hmlkr0krt6/aHR0cHM6Ly9jbXMuc3RhcnR1cHRvc2NhbGV1cC5jb20vcHJvZHVjdHMvMS1oci1zdGFydC11cC1jb25zdWx0aW5nLWNhbGw_bGN0Zz1xMzB2Nnd6dw==
) time with me.

-- James​

(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/xmum3px6e6f6hr0qm36igu03owzll/qvh8h7hrqo9volhl/aHR0cHM6Ly80MnYuaW8vP3V0bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnNvdXJjZT1TdGFydFVwVG9TY2FsZVVwJmxjdGc9cTMwdjZ3enc=
)

​ (

emails.subject: Is fundraising back?
emails.snippet: Plus: Previews of Q1 PE, VC data; tech underpins online safety; organ transplatation investment opportunities & more Read online | Don't want to receive these emails? Manage your subscription.
emails.body:
Plus: Previews of Q1 PE, VC data; tech underpins online safety; organ transplatation investment opportunities & more
Read online | Don't want to receive these emails? Manage your subscription.
Log in
The Weekend Pitch
April 7, 2024
Presented by Intapp
(Drew Sanders/PitchBook News)
This is The Weekend Pitch, and I'm Jessica Hamlin. You can reach me at jessica.hamlin@pitchbook.com or on X @jessicaAhamlin.

I'm back. Is fundraising back?

I spent the past week by the pool in sunny Florida with my Slack notifications paused and my phone on "do not disturb." Monday morning, I returned to my desk in New York City: sunburnt, well-rested and ready to sift through more than 600 emails.

Forty minutes and a cup of coffee later, I had read through what felt like the highest concentration of fund news I'd received in the span of one week since 2022.

So. Many. Significant. Fund closes.
read more
 
Share:
 
A message from Intapp  
Enable healthy deal flow at your commercial real estate firm
The most fruitful commercial real estate (CRE) transactions are always a mix of science and art, hard calculations, and human creativity — which can, at times, make them unpredictable and difficult to prepare for. When a CRE team better understands each unique stage of a transaction and equips themselves with the most advanced technology to support their pipeline, firms can work smarter and faster to close successful deals.

Download Intapp's guide on understanding and preparing for each stage of a commercial real estate transaction and learn what to expect as your deal team moves a deal through the pipeline.
Share:
 
 

Get the download on Q1 data

(PM Images/Getty Images)
PE and VC dealmakers remain fixated on the exit markets, which are critical to releasing capital that can be funneled into new deals. Despite a few large tech IPOs and PE-backed sales, overall activity was underwhelming.

Dive into our venture capital and private equity Q1 2024 First Look reports for the latest data on exits, fundraising, deals and more.
 

Trivia
The fundraising environment has been a difficult one for venture firms, with LPs more cautious amid a tepid backdrop of elevated interest rates. According to our Q1 2024 PitchBook Global Venture First Look, how much have VCs raised in 2024?

A) $30.4 billion
B) $22.7 billion
C) $48.9 billion
D) $17.5 billion

Find your answer at the bottom of The Weekend Pitch!
 

Stay tuned
Keep an eye out for these insights and research reports coming out this week:
  • Q1 2024 US PE Breakdown
  • Q1 2024 PitchBook-NVCA Venture Monitor
 

What tech works behind the
scenes to keep us safe online?

(Stevecoleimages/Getty Images)
Combating digital threats like misinformation, fraud and exploitation is made more difficult by their dynamic nature. Trust and safety technologies, the subject of our recent Emerging Space Brief, are multifaceted protection services that combine advanced tech and processes.

With wide-ranging use cases, they shield users of social media and dating platforms, streaming services, forum and collaborative platforms, online marketplaces, government and public services, and gaming, fintech and edtech online platforms.
 

Opportunities arise in
organ transplant technology

A combined market opportunity of at least $7 billion exists within the organ transplant space, writes PitchBook analyst Aaron DeGagne. With AI emerging as a key new tool and government involvement in the space, new opportunities are aplenty for investors to jump in.

Our recent Emerging Technology Research dives deep into the space and where those opportunities are for investors.
 

Quote/Unquote
(John Keeble/Getty Images)
"The private equity asset class is three times bigger than it was 10 years ago. You have an industry that has completely exploded in size and will only continue to grow. So, we are at a pivotal moment where assets have grown exponentially but the traditional exit routes are not keeping up."

—W Capital Partners co-founder and managing partner David Wachter talking to PitchBook News about the growing interest in secondaries. AXA Investment Managers has agreed to acquire the secondaries-focused firm.
 

Trivia
(PM Images/Getty Images)
Answer: A.

So far this year, VC firms have raised $30.4 billion globally across 293 funds. Here's a first look at our Q1 2024 PitchBook Global Venture First Look.

This edition of The Weekend Pitch was written by Jessica Hamlin, James Thorne, Clarinda Simpson and Jacob Robbins. It was edited by Heather West and Clarinda Simpson.

emails.subject: Characteristics of successful consumer founders; The career benefits of self-management; Shifting positioning as y…
emails.body:
View this post on the web at https://femstreet.substack.com/p/femstreetissue285

Welcome to Femstreet’s life online. I’m Sarah [ https://substack.com/redirect/df68cae0-e2ac-40be-8aed-a059e2b91395?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] and this is the 285th edition of Femstreet.
Thank you for reading Femstreet. If you enjoy this issue, please share it with your friends and like it above.
Insights
After tripling its revenue in 2023, ICONIQ Growth doubles down on French startup Pigment, founded by Eléonore Crespo, with an additional $145M [ https://substack.com/redirect/34815948-caac-46d6-99fa-014f28e88d8a?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]. Rachel Romer, founder of $4.4B edtech unicorn Guild, shares lessons from having a stroke at age 34.  [ https://substack.com/redirect/dfa55456-48c2-45be-8449-0ff4de78e432?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]Bumble’s new CEO talks about her critical mission to spice things up [ https://substack.com/redirect/642cffdf-6bb5-4bdc-bd70-538413805b23?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] at the company. Lux Capital’s Deena Shakir published a book on entrepreneurship to encourage young girls  [ https://substack.com/redirect/a132d21c-5bb9-491a-ade9-58afae25e63f?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]to follow their imagination and ambition to do great things. 3 strategies for speaking up at work and building buy-In [ https://substack.com/redirect/e64a25b8-12b8-45ee-b79e-c796b5754e6a?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] and understanding from your team. Rosie Huntington-Whiteley joins The Equity Studio [ https://substack.com/redirect/ad93bd3c-433d-4723-9765-40d2d42642b1?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ], a new investment firm backing beauty, wellness, lifestyle brands. IVP’s General Partner Cack Wilhelm discusses the VC exit landscape [ https://substack.com/redirect/b57895be-f1e1-4787-9eaa-7b8787a052b8?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] for this year. How to create a company culture that takes your team from good to great. [ https://substack.com/redirect/b81a09d6-f865-4491-bc47-ce2766252b9b?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] Ellevest’s Sallie Krawcheck’s best advice on recovering from career setbacks. [ https://substack.com/redirect/aee5d355-3baf-42f4-a11f-5ff85a74f18c?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] Ex-Tinder CEO Renate Nyborg thinks advanced AI can help cure loneliness.  [ https://substack.com/redirect/31041d84-cb22-489e-a8de-77c1d63c510e?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]Serena Williams has invested in 85 companies and 14 have unicorn status.  [ https://substack.com/redirect/51c3e677-e5de-4e62-9103-a1bf2b3b60c0?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]GV invests $5.4M [ https://substack.com/redirect/b8e8a6e9-798e-4f55-8220-1bb77dc42018?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] in Home From College, a career platform for Gen Z co-founded by Julia Haber ex Snap. 
From builders and investors in our universe…
What makes for successful consumer founders
As early-stage investors, while we often talk about companies, we really invest in people, specifically those who are rewriting the narratives of how we live, work, and play. Conventional wisdom often dictates the ideal profile for successful consumer founders. But do the stereotypical "Stanford CS grads" and "former Google PMs" really hold the keys to outsized success? Meera Clark of Redpoint analysed 100+ unicorns in hopes of debunking the generally accepted stereotypes surrounding what traits define successful consumer founders. Are you in for a surprise?…Read more. [ https://substack.com/redirect/4fbad767-2f2c-4a90-b922-8bc22e391430?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
What it means to ideate and validate your product
The months and even years Pre-Product-Market-Fit can feel like wandering in the dark for founders - trying to hone the right ICP, the right messaging, the right positioning, the right value prop - the testing, testing, testing on all the ways to land Product Market Fit. This stage requires a lot of hustle, but also a delicate dance of speed and quality. But there is no one formula. Work-Bench’s Jessica Lin shares a few general rules of thumbs to consider for any founders building for the enterprise…Read more. [ https://substack.com/redirect/acdfe3f8-a163-48cb-b1ed-21ef2846280c?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
What MidJourney, DeepL, ElevenLabs, and HeyGen have in common
Conventional wisdom suggests incumbents, not startups, are best positioned to capitalize on AI's potential. But this trope oversimplifies a new class of B2B AI companies unlocking tremendous revenue momentum by leveraging a timeless consumer recipe: providing a 10x better experience at a fraction of the cost. Benchmark’s Sarah Tavel explores how AI startups are poised to replicate the success of consumer giants by unlocking limitless use cases through superior experiences and structural cost advantages…Read more. [ https://substack.com/redirect/803305dc-4cf3-4d5e-8fc2-ef29346fc6c7?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
Shifting positioning as your product matures 
Consumer products rarely shift positioning, but for B2B products, repositioning is the norm. April Dunford explores how this key difference stems from the distinct purchasing behaviors in consumer versus B2B. April on why you need to separate your longer-term vision from what you are selling right now and why you should expect your positioning to change over time and have the processes in place to review and adjust…Read more. [ https://substack.com/redirect/cfdb33da-f355-499f-991b-0d5b2d2f8084?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
The career benefits of self-management
In the workplace, self-management is an employee’s ability to solve problems independently, show self-awareness, and operate autonomously. Why should you self-manage, isn’t this your manager’s job? In theory yes, in practice things are a bit more nuanced. Irina Stanescu shares how self-management can help your career and the 8 skills needed to master it…Read more.  [ https://substack.com/redirect/47ce1475-897c-4547-af75-9164277a7f56?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
Five non-obvious skills for product & growth managers 
Product Leaders must navigate a rapidly evolving landscape with new challenges and opportunities. Leah Tharin shares five essential skills that are often overlooked but can make or break your success as a Product Leader. From the art of summarization to the importance of managing up, and from understanding cross-functional silos to questioning your own basics, her article provides a roadmap for staying ahead of the curve…Read more.  [ https://substack.com/redirect/7a9d0151-1e65-48a8-89de-a0dc854b7a55?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
Join the Femstreet Talent Collective!
Are you looking for a new, big gig? Applicants, please apply to join our Talent Collective here. [ https://substack.com/redirect/941926de-6941-4ce2-8734-17a24fc52e81?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] New opportunities await.
We’ve got 300+ incredibly talented women in our Collective! Companies can get 1 month of 50% off our Collective with the code femstreet50, cancel anytime.
For companies: If you're hiring, apply to start getting bi-monthly drops of amazing people in our community for new gigs across Product, VC, Chief of Staff profiles, Marketing, UX, Strategy etc — actively or passively. Apply to join now and choose from the open talent looking for their next thing here. [ https://substack.com/redirect/96dee891-1adf-4465-b7de-fc5c43fc2101?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
25% of our audience say the first thing they do when they wake up on Sunday morning is read Femstreet.
Our subscribers value Femstreet’s content: the open rate for Femstreet’s newsletter is more than 2x the industry average. 
Brands such as Affinity, Mercury, and Carta value Femstreet. Our readers are global, diverse, ambitious professionals, and entrepreneurs.
Connect with our community of young female business professionals and decision-makers, and tell your story from a source our readers trust.  
***We now have 3 exclusive spots for Femstreet Gold sponsors: guaranteed 6 months of exposure to our audience with your logo on our website and blog + one newsletter appearance included. 
In case you missed our recent posts
Empowering the CFO suite and B2B workflows [ https://substack.com/redirect/2fd8b7af-f1b2-4f31-a081-5e0b8591f42a?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
Why SaaS founders should embrace their inner scientist on the path to $1M ARR [ https://substack.com/redirect/8685d5d3-1d2c-4606-8cbb-f0b0eddb02c7?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
Building a sustainable company without running out of runway [ https://substack.com/redirect/61e125ce-fd7c-4c2f-9aab-eedbbacc1dcd?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
What it means to be an interim leader [ https://substack.com/redirect/0ff81eb5-7265-4181-a850-2e3ec87239a9?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
The secrets of owning your odds and how founders can learn from athletes to build better teams [ https://substack.com/redirect/fe54c3dc-9622-4915-b7eb-ffaf37098b4b?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
A story of pricing, trial retention & purchase UX flows [ https://substack.com/redirect/4dade4a3-5831-4eb8-a66a-74534e54bd37?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
Modern GTM motions for a SaaS startups [ https://substack.com/redirect/9528ccfa-541d-43cd-af6c-3f7dd3600f8c?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
The Minimum Viable Finance Set Up [ https://substack.com/redirect/a1952824-5867-429d-be23-e0e635805b19?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
Community-Led Growth Nirvana [ https://substack.com/redirect/b22f5a90-5778-4f65-9556-ecc7c952ce35?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
A straight-talking deep dive into the equity terms that matter for founders [ https://substack.com/redirect/f97ea673-4276-405f-bf06-37f23a2ec5dc?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
Me, My Teen Self and Instagram [ https://substack.com/redirect/cd297f71-2b0c-4946-942f-138bef07c805?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]
Thanks for tuning in this Sunday!

emails.subject: Re: BrewDog on April 11th?
emails.snippet: Hi Jessica, Thanks for the invitation sounds like a cool event. Yes, I am half based in Berlin but will be in SF/Bay Area till mid summer. Maybe next time! Best, Mihri Minaz co-founder @usebeams.com On
emails.body:
Hi Jessica,

Thanks for the invitation sounds like a cool event. 
Yes, I am half based in Berlin but will be in SF/Bay Area till mid summer.
Maybe next time!

Best,
Mihri Minaz
co-founder @usebeams.com <https://usebeams.com/>

> On Apr 6, 2024, at 4:48 AM, Jessica Volbrecht <jessica@growthmentorhq.com> wrote:
> 
> Hey Mihri,
> 
> You're based in Berlin, right? 
> 
> We're hosting the "Berlin Startup Networking" event on April 11th at BrewDog Mitte at 6 PM and have just added a few more spots. 
> 
> It's a chance to rub shoulders with founders, marketers, and product gurus while enjoying some good food and drinks. Let's call it a blend of fun, networking, and learning.
> 
> We’ve hosted over 50 meetups around the world and the overarching theme is exactly the same no matter where the meetups are held (as they mirror that of our platform itself): Create meaningful connections through networking and talking shop about growth.
> 
> Wanna come?
> 
> All the best, 
> Jessica Volbrecht
> COO at GrowthMentor 
> Let’s connect: LinkedIn <https://click.sleadtrack.com/link?messageId=%3Csw-f4d2dc95-03f8-44a7-9c6f-ff89337d477d%40growthmentorhq.com%3E&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fin%2Fjessica-volbrecht%2F> 
> 
> P.S. - To sweeten the deal for you, here's a link to the Eventbrite <https://click.sleadtrack.com/link?messageId=%3Csw-f4d2dc95-03f8-44a7-9c6f-ff89337d477d%40growthmentorhq.com%3E&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eventbrite.com%2Fe%2Fberlin-startup-networking-tickets-828413315527%3Fdiscount%3Dberlin-invite> with a 50% discount code applied to reserve your spot.

emails.subject: BrewDog on April 11th?
emails.snippet: Hey Mihri, You're based in Berlin, right? We're hosting the "Berlin Startup Networking" event on April 11th at BrewDog Mitte at 6 PM and have just added a few more spots. It's a
emails.body:
Hey Mihri,

You're based in Berlin, right? 

We're hosting the "Berlin Startup Networking" event on April 11th at BrewDog Mitte at 6 PM and have just added a few more spots. 

It's a chance to rub shoulders with founders, marketers, and product gurus while enjoying some good food and drinks. Let's call it a blend of fun, networking, and learning.

We’ve hosted over 50 meetups around the world and the overarching theme is exactly the same no matter where the meetups are held (as they mirror that of our platform itself): Create meaningful connections through networking and talking shop about growth.

Wanna come?

All the best, 
Jessica Volbrecht
COO at GrowthMentor 
Let’s connect: LinkedIn 

P.S. - To sweeten the deal for you, here's a link to the Eventbrite with a 50% discount code applied to reserve your spot.

emails.subject: 💡 Do Startups Need a Financial Model?
emails.body:
Hey y’all — this may sound crazy outside of Silicon Valley, but financial models are controversial when you’re fundraising.

So much so that [this tweet](https://twitter.com/jefielding/status/1774613308663791659?s=20) blew up this week with strong opinions on both sides (I’d _highly_ recommend spending some time reading through both the replies and the quote tweets after you’re done with the newsletter):

Tweet:  (https://twitter.com/jefielding/status/1774613308663791659?s=20)

Jenny was the Managing Director at Techstars for 7 years and has backed unicorns at the earliest stages.

For her, and many investors (including many outside Silicon Valley), having a financial model indicates a founder is thinking critically about understanding the levers they have to pull to grow their business.

But for others it’s a red flag that the founder either prioritizes things that don’t matter, or doesn’t realize that everything about their plan will change over the life of the company. Both can be dealbreakers.

So — who’s right?

Let’s break down both sides of the argument and find the truth.

----------
_Forwarded this email? __[Join 75,000 founders](https://go.houck.news/subscribe)__ and sign up now._


----------View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/093b6b3d-1a2a-474e-acf6-a281d4c73bc6/Group_168.png?t=1702334671)
Caption: 

----------
## 🤝** A Message from **[**webAI**](https://www.webai.com/enterprise?utm_campaign=Early%20Access&utm_source=email&utm_medium=main-ad&utm_content=houcks-newsletter)

[Meet Navigator](https://www.webai.com/enterprise?utm_campaign=Early%20Access&utm_source=email&utm_medium=main-ad&utm_content=houcks-newsletter) — the easiest way to securely build AI powered apps

With Navigator’s no-code or full-code canvas and training wizard, every person on your team has the power and flexibility to build and train computer vision models the way that best suits them. With the training on local compute you can be confident your data and models are private and secure.

Quickly prototype apps using your models by connecting data sources and UI components, and deploy to the edge or cloud when you’re ready.

Focus on building your vision. Let Navigator do the heavy lifting.

Sign Up For Early Access (https://www.webai.com/enterprise?utm_campaign=Early%20Access&utm_source=email&utm_medium=main-ad&utm_content=houcks-newsletter)

~_Want to stop seeing ads? _~~__[Upgrade now](https://go.houck.news/upgrade)__~~_. Want to get in front of 75,000+ founders? Go _~~__[here](https://go.houck.news/partner)__~~_._~

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/093b6b3d-1a2a-474e-acf6-a281d4c73bc6/Group_168.png?t=1702334671)
Caption: 


--------------------
This is April’s ✨** free deep dive **✨ — [become a member](https://go.houck.news/upgrade) to get a new one each week and the full library of 90+.


----------## **Does Fundraising Require a Financial Model?**

### **Huh? Why Would You Not Want a Financial Model?**

When you learn about entrepreneurship in school you’re taught to have a clear, strong business plan and financial model when you start out, and to use that as a way to communicate the path your business will take.

The real world is much messier.

Any plan you had when you started (you know, that time before you actually learned how your ICP will respond to anything) gets changed quickly and many times.

In fact it changes so many times that you realize you could have learned what you now know faster if you hadn’t spent the time making the initial plan.

If you’re reading this newsletter you probably already know that.

Every day or even hour of your time that you devote to your startup needs to be spent getting it off the ground.

The same is true for a financial model.

Your projections will be wildly wrong.

Not only that, but the levers you have at your disposal in the model may not end up being what you think they’ll be — the entire business may change, and you likely don’t know enough yet at the pre-seed stage to be sure.

Investors all know this.

They see tons of startups and have many first-hand datapoints showing that everything can change and often does.

What they don’t know is if YOU know that.

Investors are looking to de-risk the idea of investing in you. Startups are inherently so risky that they look for ways to think of your startup as less risky than others.

One of those ways is to assess your founder mindset — how much do you “get” what being a founder will really be like?

The thinking there is that the more you “get” it the more you’ll be able to anticipate challenges and emotionally steady when things get rocky.

This is a very common place where first-time founders and founders who don’t have a strong network in Silicon Valley fail to build trust with an investor.

That might not be fair, but it’s true.

Two of those signals for how well someone is ready to be a venture-backed founder are:

1. How well they know how to prioritize their time

2. Whether they realize everything will change from their “plan” or not

Presenting investors with detailed financial projections at the pre-seed stage fails both of those tests.

### **Ok… So Why is a Financial Model Useful Again?**

If all that is true then why does Jenny, a successful and well respected VC, want to see a financial model from pre-seed founders?

It’s not that she actually cares about your projections, or doesn’t value whether you have the “founder mentality” or not (she likely values that quite a bit too).

She and other VCs who want to see a model use it as a proxy for understanding whether a founder is able to correctly break down the incentives and value levers in a problem space.

She’s assessing a founder’s ability to do that precisely because, if the business needs to change, she wants to trust that this founder will be able to quickly figure out how to break down and evaluate new opportunities and position their product for success in a new market.

The same way you’d be able to more easily trust a civilized human than a wild beast, the thinking here is that a founder who can understand the levers in a business will make better decisions more often.

It’s just a different way of de-risking an investment opportunity and reaching conviction.

Interestingly this mindset is more common in VCs based outside of Silicon Valley.

Tweet:  (https://twitter.com/ankurnagpal/status/1774926857508442276?s=20)

I commonly hear from friends or [members](https://go.houck.news/upgrade) raising in Europe, Australia, and other places around the world that pre-seed investors want to see a full multi-year model and data room.

Whereas in SF it’s more commonly about backing the right team that’s interested in the right market and assuming the rest will figure itself out along the way.

I attribute this to a few things:

1. Startup culture has penetrated the professional class in SF so deeply that the right founder will be able to learn from others and the collective knowledge of the network as they go much more easily.

2. There’s a larger amount of capital available for VCs in SF, and more forgiveness by LPs if funds don’t perform as well as expected as long as the fund’s GP(s) are truly embedded in the SF ecosystem.

3. There is a higher per capita density of great builders in SF, so investors can be pickier.

I left SF a few years ago but this magical flywheel is truly special and can let investors focus on different indicators.

### **The Truth**

The simple takeaway here is that each investor is different. Not only do they value different traits in founders, but they feel confident getting clarity on a deal in different ways.

For some, that’s a financial model, even if both they and the founder know that everything will likely change as the business matures.

My actionable advice for founders here:

Know your investor. Talk to founders they’ve backed before, and read their content online (you can use [X advanced search](https://twitter.com/dickiebush/status/1400615906678542341) for this pretty easily) to get to know what helps them reach conviction quickly.

Also think about what type of investor _you_ want to work with. If an investor tells you they want you to spend time on a financial model for a pre-seed, do you take that as a red flag that they’ll make similar inconsequential (to you) asks in the future?

Does that matter in your decision about whether to let them onto your cap table?

Maybe, maybe not.

My personal conclusion is that I’m better off trying to understand the information that gets me to conviction as a pre-seed investor in discussions with the founder and reference checks rather than from a financial model and, as a result, as a founder I’d want to partner with likeminded investors.

But for your startup it’s up to you.

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/093b6b3d-1a2a-474e-acf6-a281d4c73bc6/Group_168.png?t=1702334671)
Caption: 

## 💡** How I Can Help**

----------
[Become a member](https://go.houck.news/upgrade) to join the community, get access to all 90+ deep dives, our founder accountability challenge, and fireside chats with experts.

I can also help your startup in a few other ways:


----------### **Growth**

### **Fundraising**

🚀 Advertise in my newsletter to [get in front of 75,000+ founders](https://go.houck.news/partner).

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/093b6b3d-1a2a-474e-acf6-a281d4c73bc6/Group_168.png?t=1702334671)
Caption: 

----------
## 💌** Share Houck’s Newsletter**

Raising soon? I’ll send over my database of over 1,800+ pitch decks (including companies like Tesla, Shopify, and YouTube), just refer one friend via your personal referral link: https://houck.news/subscribe?ref=y2Swkk9Rd7

Log in
The Research Pitch
April 6, 2024
PE data for Q1: Our PE First Looks put our data in your hands as quickly as possible, covering dealmaking, exits, fundraising, and more. To access our datapacks for PE data globally, in the US, and in Europe, click here.

March performance: Is there a light at the end of the IPO tunnel? Our Global Markets Snapshot illustrates trends in the equity, debt, and commodities markets, tracking returns across a range of indexes and sectors. Read it here.

All things LLM: On Tuesday, we're hosting a conversation with AI developer community leader Yujian Tang to discuss the state of the LLM app stack. Register here.

We're hiring! Check out these job openings on our news and product teams: PE Reporter (EMEA), Lead Product Manager, VC Reporter.
 
Global VC exit value in Q1 sank to a low not seen since 2016
Cautious optimism was a good description of venture market sentiment going into 2024. In most cases, though, it has been, "new year, same VC market."

Optimism is inherent to venture, and a single quarter won't change that, but Q1 did highlight some remaining chasms.

I'll admit that I am in the camp that believes by the end of the year, 2024 will look like a better market than what we saw in 2023. Though, taking a realistic approach to expectations for the year is important.

Global deal counts may look relatively strong, but deal value continued to trail off and Q1 finished more than $100 billion lower than the peaks we saw a couple of years ago. This higher-but-lower dichotomy points to a continued high level of extension financings—smaller deals building runway for companies—and not necessarily a gauge for new money interest.

Other concerning datapoints are easy to pick out. Fundraising and exits were, by most standards, poor.

Global exit value was the lowest quarterly total since Q4 2016. Even in the US, where Reddit and Astera Labs' IPOs generated substantial buzz, total exit value was less than $20 billion.

We are now two years into this venture correction, but there's reason to believe there is more that will be filtered out. Company counts are high, exits are low, distributions are minimal, and the market remains humbled.

Silver linings are great, but masking the remaining market structure generates a false spring.

Before our full venture reports come out over the next couple of weeks, we put together some high-level datasets as a preview that set the tone for expectations this year.

Download the data here: PitchBook Venture First Looks
 
Best,

Kyle Stanford, CAIA
Lead Analyst, Venture
Share:
 
Thematic Research  

Organ Transplant Tech

There are new opportunities aplenty in the evolving world of organ transplant tech.

Core areas of innovation—including transplant diagnostics and organ transport—have an estimated combined market opportunity of at least $7 billion.
 
See a larger version of the diagram in the research.

AI is also emerging as a tool for crossmatching and assessing rejection risk, while government involvement in the space is opening new avenues:
read the free research
 

Takeaways From the Future Food-Tech Conference

Alt-proteins took center stage at the recent Future Food-Tech event, as well as the themes of scaling and commercialization in a tough fundraising environment.

In our recap of key takeaways, we also noted that drugs like Ozempic and Wegovy will have widespread implications for the food industry as diets shift:
read the free research
 

Takeaways From the Game Developers Conference

AI was ubiquitous at GCD 2024 in San Francisco.

We identified 9 key takeaways from the gaming conference, as investors and founders discussed the industry and what innovations to expect in the near future:
read the free research
 
 
Industry & Tech Research  

Emerging Space Brief: Trust & Safety Tech

Combating digital threats like misinformation and fraud is made much more difficult by their dynamic nature.

Our new research looks at the trust and safety tech forming the bedrock of online safety across a range of sectors:
read the free research
 
 
Webinars & Events  

Save these dates!

April 17: With the interest rate landscape beginning to settle, loan investors and issuers are returning to the finance markets, heightening already-tense competition between syndicated lenders and private credit. We'll discuss it all in our quarterly webinar on the state of the US leveraged loan and private credit markets. Register here.

April 29-May 1: Come visit us at DealMAX in Las Vegas, where our lead PE analyst Tim Clarke will lead a session discussing where and when private equity firms will find exit opportunities. Register here.
 
 
In the News  

Our insights and data featured in the press:
  • Q1 borrowing activity in the US leveraged loan market hit near-record levels. [Axios]

  • Why is fundraising so slow for VCs? "At the core of the issue is exits." [FT]

  • Global venture capital investment nears a five-year low in Q1. [Reuters]

  • For thermal battery startups, valuations and fundraising are trending way up. [Fortune]

  • Expect PE activity in healthcare IT to accelerate in 2024 after last year's slump. [Axios Pro]
If you're a journalist interested in interviewing our analysts or requesting data, contact our PR team.

Hello Mihriban,

A temporary pre-authorization hold of 20.88 USD (19.35 EUR) has been put on your One card (ending with 8577) by Lyft.

☝️ This transaction has been pre-authorized and will be displayed as processing until the merchant debits or releases the hold.

 

If released, the funds might still be frozen (visible under the processing status) for up to 9 days before being available again on your account. Only the merchant can release the funds before this regulatory deadline. You just need to ask them to cancel the deposit and provide a closing receipt. Any questions? Find all our answers by visiting our help center.

emails.subject: Staying in Business, Accelerators, & Learnings from Startup Experience
emails.body:
_Hey 👋🏽_

_Welcome to the 94th edition of Re:VITALIZE, a newsletter with tactics, strategies, and stories on building companies plus our favorite future of work reads, going out to _**_3,400+ people each week_**_. Forward to a friend who may want to __[_subscribe_](https://vitalizevc.beehiiv.com/subscribe)__._

———————————————————————————

# **Top 3 Tweets**

### 🥇** Staying in Business**

Tweet:  (https://twitter.com/adrienne_lain/status/1772597308212826502)

### 🥈** Accelerator Insights**

Tweet:  (https://twitter.com/heyalexfriedman/status/1775189454237413720)

### 🥉** Insider Tips from Startup Experience**

Tweet:  (https://twitter.com/VittoStack/status/1772268077280788987)

———————————————————————————

# **Founder Resources﻿**

* [Crowdsourced:](https://twitter.com/Zecca_Lehn/status/1775165081426534504) Should Founders include a traction slide in their deck?

* [3 natural competitive advantages](https://twitter.com/jjen_abel/status/1771529277726466538) of early-stage startups

* [Strategy mistakes startup CEOs are making](https://twitter.com/aymanalabdul/status/1770785116391907656) with their strategy

* [9 pitch decks](https://twitter.com/callmehouck/status/1772604678435402209) from unicorn startups

* [How To Set The Right Valuation](https://houck.news/p/what-valuation-is)

* Improving your [SaaS sales demos](https://twitter.com/Chris_Orlob/status/1771328328273981949)

* A Founder’s Guide for Successful [Early-Stage Customer Discovery](https://review.firstround.com/how-to-know-if-your-ideas-the-right-one-a-founders-guide-for-successful-early-stage-customer-discovery/)

* [The importance of distribution](https://twitter.com/agazdecki/status/1772247711082815862) in early-stage startup growth

* Stages of taking a product [from idea to market](https://twitter.com/KhodorMahmoud/status/1771203861912432874)

———————————————————————————

# **Future of Work Reads**

* Remote work curbs salaries - new data ([WEF](https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2024/03/remote-work-jobs/))

* What’s It Like to Work for a Gen Z Boss? Very Different ([WSJ](https://www.wsj.com/lifestyle/workplace/gen-z-managers-workplace-37348974?mod=careers_more_article_pos7))

* Cultivating Critical Soft Skills ([SHRM](https://www.shrm.org/topics-tools/news/managing-smart/cultivating-critical-soft-skills))

* Is Your Company’s Data Ready for Generative AI? ([HBR](https://hbr.org/2024/03/is-your-companys-data-ready-for-generative-ai))

* This is the No. 1 regret people have in their careers, says new research ([CNBC](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/03/21/the-no-1-regret-people-have-in-their-careers-says-new-research.html))

* Women Don’t Need To Be Fixed, Organizations Need To Fix Their Systems ([Forbes](https://forbes.com/sites/juliekratz/2024/03/24/women-dont-need-to-be-fixed-organizations-need-to-fix-their-systems/?sh=1fed2a3545e6))

* Feeling unproductive and burned out at work? Try practicing intentional inflexibility ([Fast Company](https://www.fastcompany.com/91067321/feeling-unproductive-and-burned-out-at-work-try-practicing-intentional-inflexibility))

———————————————————————————

# **The World of VITALIZE**

* VITALIZE portfolio company [Lectrium](https://www.lectrium.com/) released a [new update with their product](https://twitter.com/lectrium/status/1767588973449265342)

* [Suma Wealth](https://sumawealth.com/), a VITALIZE portfolio company, was featured in [Los Angeles Business Journal](https://labusinessjournal.com/featured/b-corp/)

* Jessica Chang, CEO of VITALIZE portfolio company [Upwards](https://upwards.com/), was at the [14th Annual International Women’s Day Forum](https://www.uschamberfoundation.org/education/employers-lead-the-way-in-piecing-together-childcare-solutions) in partnership with the U.S. Department of State

* CEO of VITALIZE portfolio company [Balloon](https://getballoon.com/), Amanda Greenberg, was on [SBJ Unpacks podcast](https://open.spotify.com/episode/6GLqjGLmZliu5RMQKjZtTU)

* Rachel Cossar, CEO of VITALIZE portfolio company [Virtual Sapiens](https://www.virtualsapiens.co/), was on the [On Camera On Brand podcast](https://marketersindemand.com/episode/assess-improve-and-master-your-virtual-presence-with-virtual-sapiens/)

* [Open jobs](https://jobs.vitalize.vc/) at VITALIZE portfolio companies

———————————————————————————

_Written by the team at __[VITALIZE](https://vitalize.vc/)__, a venture capital firm and 500+ member __[angel investing community for everyone](https://www.vitalize.vc/vitalize-angels/)__, investing in U.S.-based B2B software founders innovating in WorkTech._ _Find us on __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/VitalizeVC)__, __[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/vitalizevc/)__, and __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6F8VX-wcx5Z6FyBYixlK8A)__._

_Learn more about __[sponsoring this newsletter](https://vitalize.notion.site/Re-VITALIZE-Sponsorship-b8c9077b64e7493b917b6779c55689b5)__._


———

You are reading a plain text version of this post. For the best experience, copy and paste this link in your browser to view the post online:
https://vitalizevc.beehiiv.com/p/staying-business-accelerators-learnings-startup-experience

emails.subject: We have some exciting news for you...
emails.snippet: Hi Everyone, My Ultraproductive co-author Eric Partaker and I have some exciting news… We're launching a brand new online training program called “Becoming Ultraproductive”. In the program, Eric
emails.body:
Hi Everyone,
My Ultraproductive [ https://substack.com/redirect/d0372745-943b-4f7a-b240-06de9afd7037?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] co-author Eric Partaker [ https://substack.com/redirect/10119f9b-095a-42e6-bc97-9779b4a6c8e6?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] and I have some exciting news…
We're launching a brand new online training program called “Becoming Ultraproductive”.
In the program, Eric and I will help you 10x your productivity... and in the process you'll also learn how to develop laser-focus, sleep much better, and better manage stress.
Our very first cohort will start later this month... and we're knocking 20% off the normal enrollment fee for this first group.
HOWEVER, there’s a catch: it’s limited to only 40 seats and applications close on April 12th.
So if you're interested in learning more, simply reply to this email with “yes”.
​We look forward to hearing from you!
Eric & Christian

emails.body:
🔥Hello, AI Enthusiasts! Buckle up as this issue of The AI Break is sizzling with the hottest advancements in AI technology! We've got fresh insights that are sure to ignite your imagination! 

Are you ready to dive in? Let's do this!

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/141a78a0-05a7-4f34-8bc8-fed52fd9f66e/giphy.gif?t=1712303646)
Caption: 

_(3-minute coffee break☕)_

———————————————————————————

#### **From Our Partners:**

“**Tenyx Unveils ‘Tenyx Voice’**

emails.subject: Question about usebeams.com
emails.snippet: Mihri, I'm pretty sure we've never met. I am Nishant. I secured your e-mail through some highly confidential sources involving a Neuronetic Thundermancer paired with highly sophisticated 100GB
emails.body:
Mihri,


I'm pretty sure we've never met. I am Nishant.


I secured your e-mail through some highly confidential sources involving a Neuronetic Thundermancer paired with highly sophisticated 100GB nutro-plasmic VPN. Jokes aside, I used Clearbit.


Here’s the deal...


You might not be aware, but I specialize in helping SAAS companies transform their non-paying, free trial users into paying subscribers through strategic e-mail nurturing.


I take care of the e-mail creation, you just need to send them out. If you don’t observe an substantial increase in paying users, you owe absolutely nothing.


Forget about high consulting fees, binding contracts, or the need for blood oaths. If I don’t generate revenue, you pay nothing.


I completely understand this might not be a problem for you, and that’s all right.


However,if it is, would you be open to discussing this?


I eagerly await your stern but fair response,


Nishant


Free-trail Conversion specialist/SaaS Lover/Below Average Runner

emails.subject: Updates from The Migrant Accelerator Community
emails.snippet: Hello everyone, Thank you for being part of this amazing community! First up we want to introduce the 12 cohort members of our Spring Batch! Warm welcome to: Deep Skin AI, a patent-pending B2B skin
emails.body:
[image: TMASpring_HD (LinkedIn Career Page Banner) (4).png]

Hello everyone,

Thank you for being part of this amazing community! First up we want to
introduce the 12 cohort members of our Spring Batch! Warm welcome to:

   -

   Deep Skin AI <https://www.deepskinai.com/>, a patent-pending B2B skin
   analysis and product recommendation for E-Commerce and R&D.
   -

   Ivy Analytics <https://ivyanalytics.io/> helps by analyzing unstructured
   data from chatbots, AI assistants, and more, giving product and marketing
   teams crucial data they need to understand users, personalize experiences,
   and drive engagement.
   -

   Loretta <http://www.loretta.care/>is a telehealth praxis and community
   platform that supports LGBTQ+-centred primary care by providing literacy,
   patient and community insight, and supporting specialized care coordination.
   -

   RESEARCHPRENEURS <http://www.researchpreneurs.com/> is an AI-driven
   matching platform that connects small and medium-sized enterprises with
   research and development experts to promote collaborative innovation.
   -

   TheCommonLanguage <https://www.thecommonlanguage.io/> is an innovative
   remote interpretation service makes professional interpretation accessible
   to everyone, wherever they are.
   -

   Topshelf <https://www.jointopshelf.com/> is an AI-powered recommendation
   app, designed to transform the beauty product shopping experience, making
   it more personalized and transparent.
   -

   Museful <http://www.museful.de/> is offering a dynamic solution for
   museum visitors to have a personalized experience using augmented reality
   and artificial intelligence making museums accessible to all.
   -

   Trashcoin <https://www.trashcoin.eu/> connects waste producers to
   recyclers in real time and gives users direct incentives.
   -

   reLi Energy <https://relienergy.de/> is a plug-and-play battery
   optimization software, resulting in up to 35% longer battery life and a 70%
   boost in profitability.
   -

   LearnSlice <https://learnslice.com/> helps trainers increase the
   engagement, knowledge, and loyalty of their apprentices by providing them
   with playful peer-to-peer learning for company onboarding and exam
   preparation with AI and gamification.
   -

   AICU <https://ai-cu.com/> makes the accesibility of statistics and data
   science for medical researchers quick and easy with automated workflows and
   transparent results.
   -

   Belle Health <https://bellehealth.co/> focuses on Hormonal Health
   Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for PMS and PMDD patients, giving personalized
   recommendations and utilizing internal data algorithms for a tailored
   experience.

You can reach out to each of them via Slack and if you’re interested in
seeing the live pitches and network with the TMA Community circle 14th June
in Berlin for the Spring Batch Demo Day! 🥂✨

------------------------------

Upcoming events:

*Thursday, 11th April 6:30 pm: *SINGA - Entrepreneurs Connect: Spring
Edition! At ProjectTogether in Berlin, register here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScS_AZ7V1dGNvNoVhPE6KWwUlzjKqLojp1hOaM0dJtylX1n6A/viewform>

Wednesday, 17th April 12-1 *pm**: *TMA Community Event with Mareike Tatic
from Women of SaaS hosted by Grace Accelerator (Zoom + in Berlin)

Monday, 6th May 11-12 pm: Visa & Immigration Office Hour with Tobias
Schönborn (every 1. Monday of the month!)

Wednesday, 8th May 12-1 pm: TMA Community Event Q&A session with Angel
Investor Marc Puškarić hosted by Quartier Zukunft I Deutsche Bank AG (Zoom
+ in Berlin)

Thursday, 13th June: Hinterland of Things Conference, access your discount
code in Slack!

Friday, 14th June: TMA Demo Day in Berlin

If you're from Berlin and want to network with fellow TMA members: The
sessions on 17th April and 8th May are streamed live at our partner
locations, you can start networking after the zoom session is done. *If you
want to join onsite send me a short reply to this email *so we can arrange
for enough drinks & snacks ;). Location details will be in the calendar
invite. If you want more* in-person networking* events in your city, reach
out to me and we will try to arrange it.

------------------------------

Since TMA is all about enabling access, we're excited to be a network
partner of Hinterland of Things this year, which is renowned for bringing
together the sharpest minds in B2B tech since 2018 and is powered by
Founders Foundation gGmbH. You can access the link to our 15% discount for
tickets in the #announcements channel on Slack
<https://themigrantaccelerator.slack.com/>.

------------------------------

Feel free to forward this email to fellow migrant founders and encourage
them to join our Slack Community to benefit from the offers: bit.ly/Join_TMA

Have a great weekend,

Laila

PS: Keep your eyes peeled, we will do a giveaway of all access coworking
passes with a new partner in our #announcements channel in Slack
<https://themigrantaccelerator.slack.com/> very soon!
-- 
Laila Zohaib
Managing Director @ The Migrant Accelerator
https://www.themigrantaccelerator.com/
<https://www.themigrantaccelerator.com/>

*++ Awarded 4x4 under 40 by Wirtschaftsjunioren Deutschland & SZ Institute
++*

emails.snippet: Manulife goes all in on GP-led secondaries; Blue Owl taps the insurance industry; France runs out of PE mega-deals, exits Read online | Don't want to receive these emails? Manage your subscription.
emails.body:
Manulife goes all in on GP-led secondaries; Blue Owl taps the insurance industry; France runs out of PE mega-deals, exits
Read online | Don't want to receive these emails? Manage your subscription.
Log in
The Daily Pitch: VC, PE and M&A
April 5, 2024
The Daily Pitch is powered by PitchBook’s industry-defining research and best-in-class data
In today's Daily Pitch, you'll find:
  • Manulife Investment Management's secondaries team goes all in on GP-led deals

  • Blue Owl's big move into insurance

  • Our Data Analytics report outlines the trends and opportunities defining the industry

  • In France, big PE deals basically disappeared in 2023
 
Today's Top Stories  
Mining the data analytics vertical
The data analytics vertical has reliably produced some of the largest, highest-growth new companies of recent decades, from Snowflake to Palantir. Our first-ever Data Analytics report outlines the trends and critical opportunities that will define the industry in years to come.
  • We estimate that the data analytics market attracted $201.8 billion in spending in 2023 and will grow at an 18.1% CAGR through 2026.

  • Since 2019, data analytics companies have raised between 19% and 22% of global software funding each year—demonstrating consistent investor commitment to the space.

  • Generative AI offers new opportunities for innovation and investment in conventional data analytics categories like data lakes and business intelligence.
read the preview
 
Share:
Manulife unveils debut fund dedicated to GP-led secondary deals
(Wei Fang/Getty Images)
Manulife Investment Management's latest fund is dedicated to GP-led secondary deals. It is the first secondaries vehicle raised by the Toronto-based asset manager to include third-party capital.

Jeff Hammer, co-head of Manulife IM's secondaries business, shared with senior reporter Madeline Shi why he's optimistic about the returns that can be generated by GP-led secondary deals.
read more
 
Share:
 
A message from PitchBook  
Be a part of the largest newsletter in private financial markets
No other newsletter can match our audience. By partnering with PitchBook Media, reach over 2 million industry professionals spanning the C-suite to flagship GP offices. Select what works best for you from a unique array of options in the brand-new 2024 PitchBook Media Kit, including:
  • Sponsorship of market-leading reports such as the PitchBook-NVCA Venture Monitor
  • Placement in the most widely read industry newsletters such as the Weekend Pitch
  • Sponsored columns to share your differentiated viewpoints to prospective clients
Talk to us
Share:
 
Blue Owl opens fundraising channel with insurance move
(PBNJ Productions/Getty Images)
Blue Owl Capital announced this week it will spend $750 million to acquire Kuvare Asset Management, a boutique investment management firm that services the insurance industry, opening up an additional fundraising channel for the firm.

The firm plans to launch Blue Owl Insurance Solutions, which will tap into the $20 trillion-plus global life and annuity insurance industry and provide additional, permanent investor capital to Blue Owl.
read more
 
Share:
Leveraged finance survey: Market conditions strengthen
(Hpphtns/Shutterstock)
LCD's Q1 Leveraged Finance Survey of buy-side, sell-side and advisory professionals showed bullishness toward the leveraged loan asset class. Loan allocations, including for M&A, are expected to increase, and returns could outperform. Default projections for 2024 are down by a full percentage point from the previous quarterly survey.
read more
 
Share:
France sees dearth of PE mega-deals and exits
(Alexander Spatari/Getty Images)
French private equity dealmaking faced a bumpy road in 2023. The year ended on a low, with not a single deal valued at €1 billion or more announced during Q4, as highlighted by PitchBook's Q4 2023 France Market Snapshot.

However, there is some cause for optimism for better performance during 2024 as the French economy is forecast to outperform its European peers.
read more
 
Share:
VC-backed IPOs leave Europe behind
(Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images)
The US has seen a handful of high-profile public listings of tech companies this year, but the IPO window in Europe remains firmly shut.

Larger rallies in public equities and a more open attitude toward risk is boosting listing activity in the US—and leaving Europe behind.
read more

VC Deals  
Indian fintech startup Navi is in talks to raise up to $400 million at a $2 billion valuation, TechCrunch reported.

Paris' Pigment closed a $145 million Series D led by Iconiq Growth for its business planning platform.

California-based Aerospike raised $109 million in growth funding from Sumeru Equity Partners for its AI database, analytics and transaction platform.

SiMa.ai, an AI and machine learning-centric chip startup based in San Jose, raised $70 million in a round led by Maverick Capital.

Swiss biopharmaceutical startup Neurosterix, which specializes in neurological disorders, raised a $63 million Series A led by Perceptive Advisors.

Metabolic health startup Biolinq, which is based in San Diego, raised a $58 million in a round led by Alpha Wave Ventures.

San Francisco-based Coalesce raised a $50 million Series B led by Industry Ventures and Emergence Capital for its data management platform.

Electronica Finance raised $48 million in a round led by LeapFrog Investments. The Indian company provides loans to micro, small and medium-sized enterprises

India's SingleInterface, a marketing software provider, secured $30 million in a round led by Asia Partners.

UK-based biotech startup EnteroBiotix raised £27 million from investors including Thairm Bio, Kineticos Life Sciences and Scottish Enterprise.

Biofidelity, a UK-based developer of genomic analysis technologies, secured $24 million from investors including Octopus Ventures, BlueYard Capital and Longwall Ventures.
 
PE Deals  
Film studio Skydance Media is in merger talks with media company Paramount Global, which recently rejected a $26 billion takeover offer from Apollo Global Management, the Financial Times reported.

TPG agreed to acquire collision repair company Classic Collision from New Mountain Capital.

EQT entered exclusive negotiations to acquire French smart water and heat metering company Ocea Group from ICG Infrastructure.

Commercial electric vehicle charging company EV Realty formed a $200 million joint venture with GreenPoint Partners to develop charging hubs, Axios reported.

BlackRock and KKR sold their 40% stake in Adnoc's oil pipeline network to Lunate, an Abu Dhabi-based firm, Bloomberg reported.

GTCR-backed Once For All acquired Spanish supply chain risk and compliance management software startup Nalanda. PSG, which acquired a majority stake in Nalanda in 2021, will retain a minority stake.
 
Exits & IPOs  
Summit Partners is exploring a sale of men's grooming brand Dr. Squatch for over $2 billion, Reuters reported.

Arsenal Capital Partners sold protective coating and sealing solutions supplier Seal For Life to Henkel.

School meals provider Revolution Foods is working with Kroll Investment Bank on a sale process, Axios reported.

SnapCare has purchased Medecipher, the VC-backed provider of a nurse scheduling platform.
 
Fundraising  
SK Capital Partners held the final close of its flagship Fund VI on $2.95 billion.

Clarion Capital Partners closed its fourth fund, Clarion Investors IV, on $677 million.
 
Chart of the Day  
Source: Q4 2023 Healthcare Services Report
