emails.subject: From Party to Paradigm Shift: A Burning Man Masterclass on Transformative Experiences | Heather Gallagher
emails.snippet: Futurespaces From Party to Paradigm Shift: A Burning Man Masterclass on Transformative Experiences | Heather Gallagher ​ Thursday April 11th 10:00 AM PST | 1:00 PM EST Dive into 'From Party to
emails.body:
From Party to Paradigm Shift: A Burning Man Masterclass on Transformative Experiences | Heather Gallagher
Thursday April 11th 10:00 AM PST | 1:00 PM EST Dive into ‘From Party to Paradigm Shift: A Burning Man Masterclass on Transformative Experiences,’ where Heather Gallagher, former Burning Man executive, decodes the mysterious power of the world's most enigmatic gathering. Forget what you think you know. Her unique insights transcend the usual perceptions of Burning Man, revealing how it is the penultimate experience for personal, collective, and global transformation. Explore the alchemy that transforms a desert celebration into a global masterclass on crafting life-changing experiences. RSVP HERE - https://lu.ma/fs_heather_gallagher RSVP HERE - https://lu.ma/fs_heather_gallagher About Heather Gallagher: Heather Gallagher was an integral part of Burning Man's senior event leadership and executive oversight for almost two decades, helping to shape and grow a global culture of creativity, community, and transformation. Alongside her significant contributions there, Heather studied numerous transformative rituals and esoteric traditions, honing her ability to create impactful experiences. In 2019, Heather transitioned into immersive entertainment, leveraging her extensive experience to innovate across various immersive formats. As a Founding Circle Member of the World Experience Organization (WXO), she is recognized as an authority in the experience economy and a visionary in immersive entertainment. About Futurespaces Futurespaces delves into contemporary experience design, with a specific focus on how innovations in design and technology can meaningfully enhance human connection. Founded and led by Josh Goldblum (Bluecadet) Futurespaces offers live webinars and in-person tours that provide valuable insights into the creative process of creating contemporary experiences.
Sent using https://lu.ma

emails.subject: Thoughts of the Week: April 5, 2024
emails.body:
View this post on the web at https://drgurner.substack.com/p/thoughts-of-the-week-april-5-2024

Have you ever tried to swim in a football field? As amusing as the image is, why would you? It’s futile. No matter how adept you are, you will be hindered by an environment that is built for one direction, and you’re trying to do another. It simply isn’t constructed for your goals. 
This is true in every aspect of your life — the trick is spotting these misalignments.
Whether it is the company you’re at, the position you hold, or the actions you take, it is crucial to periodically check in to make sure they are aligned with what you want to do and who you want to be.  Are your actions or environment keeping you stuck and stagnant, or are you spreading your wings and flexing in an environment that is allowing you to do exactly what you want to do and where you want to go.
Once you take the time to realign, you will always change your trajectory for the better.  Time to pull things into position.
What You Need to Change Now. [ https://substack.com/redirect/e3dbea84-3770-4e13-817f-984f238b1aa8?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] This piece is all about self-examination, and the realizations and questions you need to ask about yourself to keep moving upward.
The Mindset of Speed. [ https://substack.com/redirect/b97f0216-3e59-4717-8ae3-8d25bef9c9ae?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] Give this edition a read to learn about the fictional speed limits that may be holding you back — and how to break them.
The 3 Pain Points (and Opportunities) of the Highly Ambitious Person. [ https://substack.com/redirect/0245a134-399d-45a0-b8d2-f7d81b3d8b6b?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] You will always be changing, and sometimes it will be hard: here’s how to get through those tough moments (and find the bright ones). 
Strategic Networking & Social Interaction Cheat Codes. [ https://substack.com/redirect/4818b035-43cb-448a-8403-bb162ad317aa?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ] Let this edition serve as a crash course in one of the most vital skills of any industry: networking
1. It is the outliers who become noteworthy — stand out from the crowd.
2. Spare two minutes as David Beckham shares his secret to success and how he balances his professional and personal life: 
3. Count their loss as your gain — they were only holding you back.
Ready to start your week with the most successful people on Earth? Become a paid subscriber of Ultra Successful to unlock exclusive access to our Monday edition.

Unsubscribe https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9kcmd1cm5lci5zdWJzdGFjay5jb20vYWN0aW9uL2Rpc2FibGVfZW1haWw_.N3bZjUkeJBB6b_dgFYgSFFCSf_-ERcjiYZ4uRg3zxpA?

emails.subject: Perfect Your English in 7 Steps
emails.snippet: Your voice is an incredible instrument. It allows you to own the room, develop a powerful presence, or simply get your point across. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
emails.body:
​

​

​

​

​

This week: 7 ways to perfect your English as a non-native speaker
/ Join me for a conversation on LinkedIn Live / Revolutionize
work & communications with AI / The best books on persuasion.

****************************************************************
How to Perfect Your English in 7 Steps (As A Non-Native Speaker)
****************************************************************

Around 1.1 billion people speak English as a second language –
like me and possibly you.

That’s almost 3 times the number of people who speak English as
their first language.

Many of the 1.1 billion are stuck on the OK plateau. That is a
challenge, especially in leadership positions.

I know, I was one of them. I moved to England for my Master’s
when I was 22, speaking average high school English. Today I
podcast, speak in public and write books in English.

Even if you don’t plan to host a podcast, being an effective
leader or entrepreneur today requires us to speak excellent
English.

Here’s how you can get there in 7 steps. I know that some of
these (especially 1 and 7) run against received wisdom and aren’t
necessarily popular. But they worked for me and will work for
you.

#1 Choose Your Accent

Don’t mix British and American pronunciation. It sounds weird for
native speakers.

Decide which English you are going to speak.

#2 Lose Your Accent

Hone in on the 10% of sounds that give you a stereotypical
accent.

If you want to imitate a German accent in English, you pronounce
the “th” as a “z”.

That’s why I had to practice my ”th” (plus my “w”, “v” and “r”).
I did it by imitating lip, tongue and mouth movements in front of
a mirror.

#3 Raise The Stakes

In “The Tim Ferriss Experiment” (on YouTube), Tim commits to
learn Tagalog in 4 days before giving a live TV interview in the
Filipino language.

I did the same when I moved to England to study. Bad English =
bad grades & few friends.

Commit to speak in public in 1 month to raise the stakes.

#4 Immerse Yourself

The typical classroom model is broken. You don’t want to spend
years in a state of mediocrity.

Immerse yourself with a coach, by spending time in a country, or
by attending an intensive course to break through the language
barrier.

(Read ‘Ultralearning’ by Scott H.Young on immersion.)

#5 Love The Culture

I lived in different countries, learning different languages.

Learning the language when I loved the culture was fun. When I
didn’t, it was hard work.

My 14-year old loves Billie Eilish and has translated all her
songs into German.

What do you love about the culture of the English-speaking world?

#6 Know How You Learn

Neuroplasticity is higher in children, yet adults like us have a
big advantage: we know how we learn best.

Is it an app like Babbel, virtual live classes like Lingoda, or
writing down every new word on a cue card to enhance
memorization?

#7 Aim For Perfection

Unpopular advice, I know. But if you want to perfect your English
to be an international business leader, aim for perfection.

Whenever I come across a word I don’t know or don’t know how to
pronounce, I look it up.

Is my English perfect? Of course not. But way better than my
20-year old self would have ever imagined.

Many people will tell you your English is good enough. I never
listened to them. And I still don’t. Instead, I enjoy the process
of improving a little bit every day – and I hope you enjoy it
too.

EVENT

***************************************
Let’s Talk! Join my LinkedIn Live & Q&A
***************************************

Don't miss out on my LinkedIn Live next Wednesday! Peter
Sorgenfrei and I will discuss the latest in effective leadership
communications.

Peter is an ace CEO coach who built six companies himself. We
will discuss how to project executive presence, build trust, use
magic words, avoid the 7 Deadly Sins of Speaking and much more.

The session will be packed with actionable advice and is a
can't-miss opportunity to ask us questions.

To join us on Wednesday, sign up here (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue5k2mdwtoh0nmnxwukhzp7n399/kkhmh6hl4lk84ztl/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubGlua2VkaW4uY29tL2V2ZW50cy83MTc5MTIwMzgxOTM5NjMwMDgwL2NvbW1lbnRzLw==
)​

​

PODCAST

*************************************
Revolutionizing Work & Communications
*************************************

Total content overload or 15 hour workweeks – what will AI bring?
In this week's fascinating episode, I speak with Dr. Léa
Steinacker, an award-winning social scientist and AI expert.

​
Co-authored with Miriam Meckel, her new book on AI became an
instant bestseller in Germany.

Léa explains how AI will impact how we communicate as profoundly
as the internet changed how we access information. She also
provides insights into the extraordinary history of AI going back
thousands of years, from ancient texts to Ada Lovelace's
pioneering work in the 1800s.

Léa discusses both the huge potential for AI to increase
productivity and creativity, as well as the risks of content
overload and struggling to distinguish what's important.

Additionally, Léa shares her secrets to speaking in front of
thousands – how she prepares, gauges what the audience needs and
how creates her trademark presence on stage.

Whether you're hoping to leverage AI's benefits, are concerned
about its implications, or simply want to communicate more
effectively, this episode will leave you much wiser about the
past, present and future of AI.

Listen on Spotify and Apple:

​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue5k2mdwtoh0nmnxwukhzp7n399/qvh8h7hrqr98qpal/aHR0cHM6Ly9vcGVuLnNwb3RpZnkuY29tL3Nob3cvNXFDMXdvdVhncWxFcTF5ZVFmOFE2MD9zaT05YTA0N2NjM2Y3MDc0YmZh
) ​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue5k2mdwtoh0nmnxwukhzp7n399/3ohphkh7v7eqveir/aHR0cHM6Ly9wb2RjYXN0cy5hcHBsZS5jb20vZGUvcG9kY2FzdC9zcGVhay1saWtlLWEtY2VvL2lkMTQ0MTQxOTUzNQ==
)

BOOK RECOMMENDATIONS

*********************
8 Books on Persuasion
*********************

#1 Influence by Robert B. Cialdini

This book explores the psychological principles that govern how
people are persuaded. Cialdini unveils the six key principles of
influence - reciprocity, commitment, social proof, liking,
authority, and scarcity.

#2 Obviously Awesome by April Dunford

Dunford offers a comprehensive framework for effective product
positioning, giving you the tools to craft compelling narratives
that resonate with your target audience, differentiate your
offerings and ultimately drive sales success.

#3 The Catalyst by Jonah Berger

Berger provides a roadmap for driving change and shaping opinions
more effectively. He introduces five key principles that allow
influencers to become catalysts - making their ideas stick,
reducing resistance, and inspiring action.

#4 Hook Point by Brendan Kane

In today's distracted world, capturing attention is more
challenging than ever - which is why Kane provides a
comprehensive guide to creating engaging "hook points" that
instantly grab your audience.

#5 The Perfect Story by Karen Eber

Eber breaks down the art of powerful storytelling, providing a
step-by-step framework for crafting narratives that captivate
audiences and drive impact. Learn how to take any story and make
it perfect.

#6 Pre-Suasion by Robert B. Cialdini

Cialdini introduces the concept of "pre-suasion" - the process of
gaining a psychological advantage before a pitch even begins. He
provides insights into optimally framing situations to be
maximally receptive to your message.

#7 Win Every Argument by Mehdi Hasan

​
This guide equips you with the essential skills for effective
argumentation, persuasion, and public speaking. Hasan teaches how
to construct logical arguments, use rhetorical techniques, and
deliver captivating speeches.

#8 Never Split The Difference by Chris Voss

​
Drawing from his experience as an FBI hostage negotiator, Voss
provides a field-tested approach to high-stakes negotiations that
generates trust and achieves maximum value.
​

​

Have an inspired weekend!

Best,

Oliver

​

Eo Ipso Communications GmbH

Friedrichstraße 68, 10117 Berlin

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue5k2mdwtoh0nmnxwukhzp7n399
) · Preferences (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/8kue5k2mdwtoh0nmnxwukhzp7n399
)​

emails.subject: New notes from Aakash Gupta, Dr. Julie Gurner, CJ Gustafson, Aakash Gupta, Aakash Gupta, and Dr. Julie Gurner

France's early AI success story, AI healthtech startups to watch and inside the climate tech unicorn factory behind Northvolt.

Sponsor Card - Flagship-13 (1) (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4Mwsfs3prCCW6N1vHY6lZ3ncW20rmnm12-JfdW7_Kywh3c9qtCW9k4gNX696XH2W3jcygf26wzjjVgyMwS7bh4pWVJ9b4S4g7g69W2Dp7-58Gx0CjW4cJzZD62gfs4W8RBnkF43JVbPW98pMcF4q5rGzN8zbk2Gf-2-4W1dMpsv8CbK9PW6l0HVs5wgcKPW8XTWxx6MwLJ5W6nMdXT7K0ZdDW6vvtxz31P1yvW19Ztst2m4Ln_VLjvmt3YNs3MMLQsWktS3PXW6l3crW3yjBY9W61GBsx5tPSYbW1Y-y445BfP_Rf70v-Yn04 )

Good morning Mihri,

While Mistral continues to grab most of the limelight in France's lively AI sector after launching last year, techies in the country are starting to turn their attention towards an AI startup that’s been a feather in the nation’s cap for a while: eight-year-old Hugging Face (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4Mwsg23prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3mJW5Z2Fr_2qBJtJW6ZpkQk1LGPDWW7MGFjD2fp22sVTRVTM5jjpw5W8MPFd14w0jKHW3mhZ2C6KZJr8W8WgbMY69p-zMW7QjS7X5dfCBrW4CMpZS1PWvhkW4Q1C_D3Rxy14W52YzrM3_XKxcN2kXpvzKq0BnW3kwB2Z60Q7qqN25NWBkk80FJN29b7LqMQ_YkW2XBwWN7HCVnSN2jV3CDByCGrW3tLjCS5tm8D0V_q6nd1ywrR0VRT8wH7Y8Y0LW7cFZy48K1FgrW8QNj7-1n8TGDW30pFpB8rn3C7VSy1867NtwlbW3bdCr68yS1KrW56QC4G8y-Kr6f4Rjf0R04 ) .

Today, French tech reporter Daphné Leprince-Ringuet traces its origins from a university rock band to an open-source AI platform that’s the talk of the town in Paris. Scroll on for that.

Elsewhere, we look at the AI healthtech startups VCs have their eyes on (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4MwsfM3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3lSW7mGMBJ8-7KjxW2yyKwZ1hylwpW2pf9TF6FKDmRW6gkYkh6DgmrKW6HVNCC5xJ7PGN26Cn0gNFLfhW8Q4xbG5F39FGW1K9nCh4cZMNKVLYcwL7P96k5N8M0hQH-w-XpV6ck8t6H3bmJW4nXZ6r7yvDBhW2Wx1gP4cSwsgW7b646R546TdQW8qrWrT96D0W0W7Z3rJ245tZbPW60rWLC5Pc6gtW6-v0Mb2QpVf6W3LqGSG7XplwsW4GzcfN4sjNXvW9bskB04FHl4dN5H2_mg-7vJWW2Y1nz18MrHPtN8NDJ9PNXNVcf29WR0004 ) , break down March’s early-stage funding data (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4Mwsg23prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3mcW825d5p4RqjpMW295fpt2wLW1WW5jxXJB735XFYW934NwN2YKvq2N3nsM3-P73-0W22SR5F4N7hYJW8DCHlH6khqGBW8Cw1jz1qzztxW8-NhRk7fPGXvVx0lNk5G8C5-W29FQM23YZM-fW5CCNFm3hs-sQW7c2vL07ll4gDW1_bW0w4cPMJbVzyw_s5RFR1MW7cc0-y3G1lBHW4Mh2st84Q0kpW8q2Kc886SPRzW642HZY3JgHbtW2fM6R05qBCPCW3lD3N845w36fW8wq2LV41lnzVW16Hp0V2D54nNW1zz5_36VsTxYW7RZXPb5f0xScW3xhpgy7-lGfjf3P9VPW04 ) and go inside the climate tech unicorn factory  (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4Mwsg23prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3ljW4SNg2y8b8cmBVL2spj8LLlbfW36ny9D67PYTbW2tg5WQ7HgDpCV1yc208hNQlHW97THGR4bnM7kW2SGLtz1yFkNXVx7LsQ1bM1STW98TzC596L78nW95lxhg5gphR4N6y3qs-BhFdqW34PSBb8zznfWW8MX1CD7ZcrqvW1WTPSx282vy_W4d2RVn5L2-KGW7r5jJX1Stg-QW4QzT5L7tb0twW8Kqng15_kq3kW8Sdphm3hrQDkW1149jY70F34hW5SGhmc2xnP82W1nkn-j1Pc8ZtW2XYJ5h8J-NnlW3cb5X65jTJRmW2pyz5K1ctx8HN3QnCj1scZk-f1Nz80C04 ) behind Northvolt and H2 Green Steel.

– Ali Humayun (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4MwsfM3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3lwW2Qlc7t5W5M3pW7zsX651WkS0GW4n6FCJ1SlVrsW2fbxRJ4TG72VW9m3q7_4jN_JvVmcFBm3L9VbgW7-gbPJ2qdqm7W2Znvr57TBSl0W8zH_xZ3yJ5NMW6pQj671c4SCSW7ZWH-l7_wWStW59Dv__5Xl7DjN2-ttp47FqwzVpJFjK4lGc5CW1WyfXm4BpJGHW2Jp69h59dsYQW6L_QXG7DxY_4V7BJS08GTkHfW1d3Fk750K6l5N6h0hHlltMp5N34zg7vq04VhW6fcmMt7CTt5SW2HsRMV4FS_mCW49CmDt8tVgCsf1sNmr204 ) , junior editor

/A message from our sponsor Moonfare (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4Mwsfs3prCCW6N1vHY6lZ3ncW20rmnm12-JfdW7_Kywh3c9qtCW9k4gNX696XH2W3jcygf26wzjjVgyMwS7bh4pWVJ9b4S4g7g69W2Dp7-58Gx0CjW4cJzZD62gfs4W8RBnkF43JVbPW98pMcF4q5rGzN8zbk2Gf-2-4W1dMpsv8CbK9PW6l0HVs5wgcKPW8XTWxx6MwLJ5W6nMdXT7K0ZdDW6vvtxz31P1yvW19Ztst2m4Ln_VLjvmt3YNs3MMLQsWktS3PXW6l3crW3yjBY9W61GBsx5tPSYbW1Y-y445BfP_Rf70v-Yn04 )

Why limit your portfolio to just stocks, shares and bonds? (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4Mwsfs3prCCW6N1vHY6lZ3mjW3jGZsK3L6MpmN88LJDsb2MdhW8sLX_r86gRpxW4qk67x5db-SdW1xx6SJ3TxKxJV225g93m2gHTW73Gw6y8w2J5CW3mFKTG7jk4kwW7RGTN98MsKdRW3fXhg084TfFFW3W36-95Kj4HQW313l_43MNGd1W7fR4hl2MDfDjW6mHxDW7Y121HW7VBz9081HWbJN1gHq7hVBBNcW19Crk93XrqMGN8_qMg4cCZT_W8TYchX47CH6HW2LYLFb25WT6hW8wz97l5r4KchW8wFh-p1Ft6wVf69YSJz04 )

Private equity funds from top-tier managers can potentially bring higher returns and diversification benefits to your investment portfolio. Try out the strategy with Moonfare.

*Subject to eligibility. Don’t invest unless you’re prepared to lose all the money you invest.

Create your free account
(https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4Mwsfs3prCCW6N1vHY6lZ3mjW3jGZsK3L6MpmN88LJDsb2MdhW8sLX_r86gRpxW4qk67x5db-SdW1xx6SJ3TxKxJV225g93m2gHTW73Gw6y8w2J5CW3mFKTG7jk4kwW7RGTN98MsKdRW3fXhg084TfFFW3W36-95Kj4HQW313l_43MNGd1W7fR4hl2MDfDjW6mHxDW7Y121HW7VBz9081HWbJN1gHq7hVBBNcW19Crk93XrqMGN8_qMg4cCZT_W8TYchX47CH6HW2LYLFb25WT6hW8wz97l5r4KchW8wFh-p1Ft6wVf69YSJz04 )

How Hugging Face got French tech talking

There’s an eight-year-old AI company that’s increasingly on everyone’s lips in France.

Founded officially in 2016 in New York by a trio of French founders, Hugging Face isn’t a new story. In fact, the company, which has built an open-source platform for developers and engineers that hosts AI models and tools, has already raised nearly $400m to date from a host of high-profile US VCs like Sequoia Capital and Coatue.

Tech big hitters like Google, Amazon, Nvidia and Intel also joined its $235m Series C closed last year, at a reported $4.5bn valuation.

But until now, the company’s gone under the radar in its home country. “They are one of these companies that are better-known in the US than in France, even though the three founders are French and they have their offices in central Paris,” one open-source startup founder tells me.

This is changing as French tech takes a heightened interest in all things AI — driven largely by the blockbuster fundraising rounds completed by Paris-based Mistral, which in less than a year after launching has raised nearly €500m. AI startups are popping up at unprecedented speed in France (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4MwsfM3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3pZW44swZ06MpTKJW2Zd8_25WHc34W6D-Mzd71MmMWW2BMDlz2RKNBbW7W7DZh2BmnsbW99zt3V55pqxNW9gKHxj2t5-wBMD9h8f8kL-0W2Gbv845tBcQ-W7D00GH5vdGMSW3wv-dl5VrbwtW19nf845tRCDJN6t91wLJzCP_W1N4Q288hltKxW35BDK86PnNQNW5-2Grr8rrpqNW8q4v5t981G6fW6n2lkK4KBCKDN6XWh4wgZyVWW5MPR3W7_wTXmVsqqRg8ptHp6W7dp4NM9gQt1XW1MPFc736MGmLN4SX2QdCskj8d-Q1Rd04 ) — and Hugging Face is increasingly being seen as an early example of success in the sector for everyone else to look up to.

So what is its secret recipe? Though the founders consider the company to be Franco-American, and its biggest team is based in Paris, the answer lies in the US — as it often does for startups over here.

From day one, Hugging Face has raised money with US investors, it’s signed partnerships with big US companies and now sees the majority of its revenue originating from the other side of the Atlantic.

And although things are moving fast in French tech, it’s a playbook that cofounder Julien Chaumond still recommends — especially when it comes to raising funds.

“French and European VCs are still one step behind in terms of the risks they are taking,” he tells Sifted.

“There is more money in Europe, but I’ve been completely blown away when talking with some of our investors in the US. It’s another level of game, and that’s still the case.”

I sat down with Chaumond to discuss Hugging Face’s success in the US (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4Mwsg23prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3mJW5Z2Fr_2qBJtJW6ZpkQk1LGPDWW7MGFjD2fp22sVTRVTM5jjpw5W8MPFd14w0jKHW3mhZ2C6KZJr8W8WgbMY69p-zMW7QjS7X5dfCBrW4CMpZS1PWvhkW4Q1C_D3Rxy14W52YzrM3_XKxcN2kXpvzKq0BnW3kwB2Z60Q7qqN25NWBkk80FJN29b7LqMQ_YkW2XBwWN7HCVnSN2jV3CDByCGrW3tLjCS5tm8D0V_q6nd1ywrR0VRT8wH7Y8Y0LW7cFZy48K1FgrW8QNj7-1n8TGDW30pFpB8rn3C7VSy1867NtwlbW3bdCr68yS1KrW56QC4G8y-Kr6f4Rjf0R04 ) , how the company is already emerging as a founders factory — and how it all started with Alanis Morissette covers…

— Daphné Leprince-Ringuet (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4MwsfM3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3lKVYNllf2dqxKXW55HJfv8dgbYzW7rmhRM1f3wp5W2WbBPz9dL0zXN1ThswRY24X9W4ZTJ0w3QR902N3L2kX_tMwxsW6TKGnt4bcdHBW4yzxDb3h9Tj3TBBcW72s_cRW5JS8gW71S3rSW3d85757r5Dq9W49gFkv5yzwQnN3XtTHB-mfmpN6z09bK_k9ZtW4S1cwf5QgD8pW73_Rq7761srZVK38j13PyC-BW6S8ZPp1wLBHkW8wvFTv3HGNN4W289NRH7w8qDjW6M1QnB6_HbQGW16RYY68hPGx1W1h2kgK4jFv16f4WxsXP04 ) , French tech reporter

🇫🇷 French SaaS company Pigment, which provides enterprise customers with a platform that lets them visualise critical business data in real-time, ranging from profit and revenue to burn rate and headcount, has raised $145m in Series D funding (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4MwsfM3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3mGW53YR2t6vhbtvN2F02bzDG6PTW7X1qQD5k-KPmV8PvXJ4YzGlkW8lLGgg8PcTQMW6N9yjx2ctGMNW51fGnf3Cz6KVW6HmgCr6W-Pq5W97qqnC8T0gJYW843Xzt1KVzf-W6GsB1V87ZLvxVr7h0N63RklyW6L-gWZ2Nh_lpW1YYjPW3_KFGpW1hDC8P1zmdxDW1BDV378Gs_vtW2hf17M4_kV9tW85JWpy3vFqhQW5HprbJ7WHPp0W73bnT763QMpCW425SJb1tcHhSW6-JGtX1YVSVbVSPjDX4tPR1mW4ccc5M6kMYGCdp0L6W04 ) to support its growth in North America.

- The equity round was led by US VC Iconiq Growth, with participation from US-based Sandberg Bernthal Venture Partners and returning investors IVP, Meritech, Greenoaks — also from the US — as well as UK VC Felix Capital.
- The company remained coy on its latest valuation, but cofounder Eléonore Crespo says it “has significantly increased since last year”.

So far this year, early-stage dealmaking is steady-as-she-goes: VCs invested €1.2bn across 336 pre-seed, seed and Series A rounds last month — roughly flat from the previous month, according to a new Sifted analysis of Dealroom data (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4Mwsg23prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3mcW825d5p4RqjpMW295fpt2wLW1WW5jxXJB735XFYW934NwN2YKvq2N3nsM3-P73-0W22SR5F4N7hYJW8DCHlH6khqGBW8Cw1jz1qzztxW8-NhRk7fPGXvVx0lNk5G8C5-W29FQM23YZM-fW5CCNFm3hs-sQW7c2vL07ll4gDW1_bW0w4cPMJbVzyw_s5RFR1MW7cc0-y3G1lBHW4Mh2st84Q0kpW8q2Kc886SPRzW642HZY3JgHbtW2fM6R05qBCPCW3lD3N845w36fW8wq2LV41lnzVW16Hp0V2D54nNW1zz5_36VsTxYW7RZXPb5f0xScW3xhpgy7-lGfjf3P9VPW04 ) .

- That March figure is still down about 14% from the same time last year.
- But perhaps surprisingly, the embattled fintech sector earned the top spot as the most well-funded area in March, with €208m raised; enterprise software startups came in second with €164m in funding.
- For more data, and the 12 rounds in March to have on your radar, read the full report here (https://email.sifted.eu/e3t/Ctc/LZ+113/d2mfCN04/VXcl-N8YkN7pW92HLbQ6R3qL6W2bnPc75cwlwyN4Mwsg23prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3mcW825d5p4RqjpMW295fpt2wLW1WW5jxXJB735XFYW934NwN2YKvq2N3nsM3-P73-0W22SR5F4N7hYJW8DCHlH6khqGBW8Cw1jz1qzztxW8-NhRk7fPGXvVx0lNk5G8C5-W29FQM23YZM-fW5CCNFm3hs-sQW7c2vL07ll4gDW1_bW0w4cPMJbVzyw_s5RFR1MW7cc0-y3G1lBHW4Mh2st84Q0kpW8q2Kc886SPRzW642HZY3JgHbtW2fM6R05qBCPCW3lD3N845w36fW8wq2LV41lnzVW16Hp0V2D54nNW1zz5_36VsTxYW7RZXPb5f0xScW3xhpgy7-lGfjf3P9VPW04 ) .

Geneva, Switzerland-based Neurosterix, a drug discovery startup developing allosteric modulator therapeutics for underserved neurological disorders, raised $63m in Series A funding. Perceptive Xontogeny Venture Fund led the round and was joined by investors including Perceptive Life Sciences Fund and Acorn Bioventures.

Glasgow, Scotland-based EnteroBiotix, a biotech developing microbiome therapeutics, raised £27m in funding, which consists of £15.7m of new equity and the conversion of £11.6m of loan notes into equity. Thairm Bio, Kineticos Life Sciences and The Scottish National Investment Bank co-led the round and were joined by Scottish Enterprise.

Cambridge, UK-based Biofidelity, which is a biotech startup working on precise treatments for cancer patients, raised $24m in funding from investors including Agilent Technologies, Octopus Ventures, BlueYard Capital, and Longwall Ventures.

Ankara-based ikas, which is an e-commerce platform that enables SMEs and entrepreneurs to open online sites without requiring technical expertise, raised $20m in Series A funding. International Finance Corporation and Re-Pie Asset Management co-led the round.

Copenhagen-based REDUCED, which uses fermentation technology to create food products made from organic surplus produce, raised €6m in funding from investors including Novo Holdings, Einar Willumsen, the Export and Investment Fund of Denmark and Rockstart Agrifood.

Stockholm-based Telness Tech, which automates user interface designs for telecommunications companies, raised €5m in funding from Industrifonden and Viltor.

Lund, Sweden-based Ironic Biotech, which is developing a portfolio of plant-derived proteins that contain iron to help individuals with iron deficiency problems, raised €1m in pre-seed funding. Nordic Foodtech VC led the round.

emails.subject: Re: OAuth Verification Request for Project Beams-Infra-Staging (id: beams-infra-staging)
emails.snippet: Dear Google OAuth team, I am sharing two demo videos that show the OAuth consent screen workflow: If Google Account is already connected and calendar access given. Also giving access to email: video
emails.body:
Dear Google OAuth team,

I am sharing two demo videos that show the OAuth consent screen workflow:

   1. If Google Account is already connected and calendar access given.
   Also giving access to email: video here
   <https://www.loom.com/share/930bf335428843b1bb0b5c62e438ec9c?sid=6e16aa57-e473-4bad-bfe9-6226364705ae>
   2. If no account is connected, I connect the Google Account incl. both
   calendar and email: video here
   <https://www.loom.com/share/aafdac5f050548d08ef2ed7444da0550?sid=a756e426-ffa8-4e06-8ecd-30ddbdef78a4>

Please let us know if you need anything else from our side.

Thank you and all the best,
Jana

*--*
*Jana Schellong*
Co-Founder @usebeams.com
+49 176 93183175

*🎉 beams was featured in TechCrunch
<https://techcrunch.com/2023/10/02/beams-helps-product-teams-shine-a-light-on-the-work-that-matters-most/amp/>
🎉*

On Wed, Mar 27, 2024 at 11:39 PM API OAuth Dev Verification <
api-oauth-dev-verification-reply+0mkvoso0guwhq1d@google.com> wrote:

> Hello Google Developer,
>
> Thank you for your patience while we reviewed your submission for project
> *beams-infra-staging*. We need you to address the following items for us
> to continue your app’s verification:
>
>    - Your demo video does not show the OAuth consent screen workflow.
>
> *Please take the following action(s) to continue with your request*
>
> ⤷ Reply to this email with the following information:
>
>    - A link to a demo video showing the OAuth workflow (Learn more
>    <https://support.google.com/cloud/answer/13804565?hl=en&ref_topic=13841839&sjid=3852194599686420982-NA#zippy=%2Cyour-demo-video-does-not-show-the-oauth-consent-screen-workflow>
>    )
>
> *Important!* Once you have addressed the issues above, reply directly to
> this email to confirm. You must reply to this email after fixing the
> highlighted issues to continue with the app verification process.
>
> *Need to make changes to your verification request?*
>
> Please make direct changes on the Cloud Console
> <https://console.developers.google.com/>. Save and submit the changes
> when finished.
>
> *No longer need access to these scopes?*
>
> Please reply to this email to cancel the verification request.
>
> *Need other help?*
>
> For more information on OAuth Verification, you can read the terms or
> policies for the APIs or products your app uses, as well as the following
> resources:
>
>    - *Link to OAuth Verification FAQ*
>    <https://support.google.com/cloud/answer/9110914#%20target=>
>
>
>
> Thank you,
>
> The Third Party Data Safety Team
>

emails.subject: Re: Shawn (Namara) <> Armagan (Coyotiv)
emails.snippet: Thanks Mihri! Moving you to BCC :) Hi Shawn and TJ, it's so nice to meet you! I'm just fascinated by your mission. Mihri mentioned some team building challenges you have been having, and I
emails.body:
Thanks Mihri! Moving you to BCC :)

Hi Shawn and T.J., it’s so nice to meet you! I’m just fascinated by your mission. Mihri mentioned some team building challenges you have been having, and I wanted to see if I can support you in any way.

For four years I’ve been running Coyotiv <https://coyotiv.com/collaboration>, an engineering ecosystem in Berlin that brings together an engineering school <https://coyotiv.com/school-of-software-engineering> and a venture builder <https://mvp.berlin/>. We have a model called “CTO-and-a-team-as-a-service” as we aim to bring on a sustainable, zero-waste engineering culture to startups facing hiring challenges.

If this sounds interesting I’d be happy to tell you more!

Kind regards,

Armagan Amcalar
Managing Director
coyotiv.com <https://coyotiv.com/>

Coyotiv GmbH
c/o Factory Works GmbH Rheinsberger Straße 76/77 10115 Berlin

Tel.: +49 (0) 30 863 20 90 83

Amtsgericht Charlottenburg HRB 217066 B
Geschäftsführer: Armagan Amcalar
USt-IdNr: DE 815873870



> On 4. Apr 2024, at 07:46, Mihri Minaz <mihri@usebeams.com> wrote:
> 
> Hi Armagan,
> 
> Please meet Shawn and T.J. from Namara team: AI-powered smart water control system that allows you to customize your home’s water flow on demand.
> 
> I'm merging you here. Feel free to cut me from the loop.
> 
> Best,
> Mihri Minaz
> co-founder @usebeams.com <https://usebeams.com/>

emails.subject: Adam Neumann and Steve Huffman join Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco, May 9
emails.snippet: Bloomberg Technology Summit | San Francisco & Virtual | May 9, 2024 New speakers have joined the mainstage at #BloombergTech this May 9 in San Francisco. ‌ Adam Neumann, the once and potentially
emails.body: New speakers have joined the mainstage at #BloombergTech this May 9 in San Francisco. Adam Neumann, the once and potentially future chief of WeWork will discuss his new VC-backed real estate venture, Flow, and his surprising overtures to buy back the bankrupt workspace provider that catapulted him to notoriety. Register today to join #BloombergTech and learn about new speakers and on-site experiences below. PURCHASE TICKET Group rates available On the Mainstage: Speakers Include Sarah Bond President of Xbox Microsoft Steve Huffman Co-Founder & CEO Reddit Renée J. James Founder, Chairman & CEO Ampere Computing Adam Neumann Co-Founder Flow VIEW AGENDA & SPEAKER LINEUP Off the Mainstage: Unique On-site Experiences Engage and interact with Engineered Arts’ humanoid robot, Ameca. Have a conversation with one of the world’s most advanced human shaped robots. Ask questions, take a selfie and gain a better understanding of the hardware and software that makes up this innovative AI-powered bot. Meet and network with Bloomberg Businessweek’s Ones to Watch in Tech. Bloomberg Businessweek’s need-to-know list in tech identifies the people poised to be the leaders of tomorrow. The names will span numerous categories – from AI to software, rockets to longevity tech, gaming to venture capital and everything in between. First chance to attend our Bloomberg Tech Community Curator sessions. High-level leaders from various tech companies will host intimate networking sessions with select groups of attendees showcasing their thought leadership and create lively discourse. Join conversations around AI on work shifting, developing your LLM strategies, and the existential risks of this technology. Date and Time Thursday, May 9, 2024 8:00 AM - 6:30 PM PDT Location The Pearl 601 19th Street San Francisco, CA 94107 Presenting Sponsor Supporting Sponsor Sent by Bloomberg Live // 731 Lexington Avenue, New York, NY 10022. View the Privacy Policy. © 2024 Bloomberg L.P. All rights reserved. Bizzabo Inc. 31W 27th St, New York, NY 10001 Copyright © 2017 Bizzabo, All rights reserved. emails.body:
Join us at the Inc. Founders House!
MAY 21, 2024 • Philadelphia, PA
Inc. Founders House is popping up at Philadelphia's Fitler Club! Founders House is an intimate founder-to-founder space built to forge deeper connections among the extraordinary people starting, running, and growing businesses. Curated exclusively for entrepreneurs of all stripes, Inc. Founders House conversations are inspirational, informative, and always honest. RSVP here. <https://go.inc.com/NjEwLUxFRS04NzIAAAGSSZnAdvDUoNYdfe-55sjrrqUHJ0yJQbC5jVUXCAX8ijO3796-biD6VcdHPNipR0Z3068335k=>

Star entrepreneurs
Snacks, apps, and cocktails

emails.subject: mihri - thanks for a great time at Capital Factory for SXSW! 🎉
emails.snippet: Thanks for joining us at the Capital Factory for SXSW! View in browser SpaveWelcomeHeader_NewLogo Hello mihri, I hope this email finds you still buzzing from the incredible energy at SXSW in Austin!
emails.body:
Thanks for joining us at the Capital Factory for SXSW!

View in browser (https://www.spave.io/e3t/Ctc/5E+113/d13J5v04/VX00Bl8vQXGvF5NbCDDv0wKW6D6W6y5cvqVmN2qdv0K5m_5PW50kH_H6lZ3pLW5QY5Xc40y4WBW1hbbPG25H7rxN7trNB8nZ1qrW6Xg-Sw7QLkrBW2rLYHp7b1mJHW10mnq114B_DrW5BtHl83TygBwW2fl8RM2T5CM0W58CxPP5B5Y-MW32krR66n5spRW7CwC393hMHgQW3pzSCD3dHndTVNQ4qX4r4VhpW89ywbf24t2wYN9c66mvchpVTN5nm2qNdtVqRW879y9z5X1kxGW880wK44wbFRkW3bjfS_6FdnfjMZwlV4fzLbQV95CHc40THDQVYMFt28nWqk0W1vWR6S8lkw7wW7NtjH71RwRx4W7J9zl644csV1VB6TRn5ZWSwYW8BTwyK1GDLG8W1h3Svm1JYK1dW7BP43b37Ln6SW6yTx7c6P1rWFV5LzgB2WHNtGN8ZxK4vZ2nyXf39tRHW04 )

SpaveWelcomeHeader_NewLogo (https://www.spave.io/e3t/Ctc/5E+113/d13J5v04/VX00Bl8vQXGvF5NbCDDv0wKW6D6W6y5cvqVmN2qdv1j3prCCW69sMD-6lZ3pZW7JNm4L5PcqKYW8g2BpX4jT0GXW96xYrx93QpWnW4kwMhm23F7bSW89xVZW716F_QVk199Y95Q2bjW2yDxGG1-R_jxW3qSPPp6FWhr7W7_dZN74gxM3_W1fsX0T4Vp9Q_W7xzKK38NdnmFW21TgPZ5ZfVZbW8Cd2Bh7yjDs6W7PRc9j11_v7GW45q2zK914wGWW5Lsh9l8PS33KW8VJNym2KTV2rW24GfP83-rztBW6VRVMT1ThRGZW21sBDl96byMNf4tH7l804 )

Hello mihri,

I hope this email finds you still buzzing from the incredible energy at SXSW in Austin! The Spave (https://www.spave.io/e3t/Ctc/5E+113/d13J5v04/VX00Bl8vQXGvF5NbCDDv0wKW6D6W6y5cvqVmN2qdv1j3prCCW69sMD-6lZ3mCW3zr27S2Gj4hYW2LS6n848TlrZW4b12Kh7wTKw_N7wXqPLPprBKN23dhBpKMdb3W1G3L783HzC8-W4Kz75K7K-x2TW806Z_41_7V17W7V3SjZ6N3C7GN4Wk11n9wVwBVlgmXQ87D5mrW6VXSxs8LDzFWW79rdJ66TKP-MW3flCbs3xyLqbVh2rHV3hVRNwW116pdV6r_rsdW6_fF5H4M8JCYW6QJgQV6xZZWDW6hh5Yy1DbPGmW8pHX4C8MdD95f5Bz5tK04 ) team is still riding high on the success of our Pop-up with a Purpose exhibit at Capital Factory, where we had the privilege of showcasing the inspirational kidpreneurs from Lemonade Day (https://www.spave.io/e3t/Ctc/5E+113/d13J5v04/VX00Bl8vQXGvF5NbCDDv0wKW6D6W6y5cvqVmN2qdv1j3prCCW69sMD-6lZ3kyVCBBzB8B8fw7W5GRjjw7dxPXRW9cDSWk1GtRkjW1FD8bh1fBpPmW1SSQb51x_x1FW3HscdW5w8G-KW6G43vY74GlykW6GgvqV2PPTYTW1l2RhL7RzvfTW3-wzK97_pgB6W8C-sRg1rZV0PW91_HW270f5JwW2-_v5p5SbCvmTgbKf1yMyt_VPpHlD5gBhGzW7w8p8-2b2YqQW5BvVg58QdX4RVn4RCX49HcYdN38ZGNMTPJMkW1rdVkw8_HWHjf71LgQz04 ) . It was an honor to have so many of you join us at Capital Factory and engage with the impactful mission of Lemonade Day, powered by Spave.

Our exhibit became the most attended event at Capital Factory during SXSW, and we couldn't be more grateful for your enthusiastic participation. To relive some of the excitement, check out the short video below to hear what others had to say about our innovative social giving technology. We're thrilled to be part of the "culture of convenience" to make it easier for consumers to give back than ever before. 🙌🏻

Spave/SXSW Showcase (https://www.spave.io/e3t/Ctc/5E+113/d13J5v04/VX00Bl8vQXGvF5NbCDDv0wKW6D6W6y5cvqVmN2qdv1j3prCCW69sMD-6lZ3myW84wcCv3-_mFBW8YN2lS5ZLhnhW1l0g7X5BWBXGW66Rlhv8gPPNdW76hv0m1sspm2N4gP80WJ2DVfN5Vy0MHwmrHKW85BwSn5Z0k2jVqxLxl6m3TG1W1VZ2Cs5R0DlwW2Pv6jz1JPpvvW2mTsHx21zx03W4xpFds7jYpvvW2dcJJg2qylTfW68-p9N5K76x-W5bGN5Q1KV8yqW3tF4qg3jC7B0V-Rt4t1SgZ65N3vh1qtQhpr4W8yKyXh15P5zJf7f7Wg-04 )

At Spave, our mission is to transform spending for good by spotlighting incredible nonprofits, like Lemonade Day. Through the Spave app, we aim to amplify support and donations to these deserving organizations. We've just rolled out the latest version of Spave, featuring a significant UI overhaul and additional user-requested functionalities—completely free of charge. If you haven't already, we invite you to explore the enhanced social giving experience by downloading or updating your app today.

Your insights, thoughts, and aspirations about charitable giving and enhancing social impact are invaluable to us. They directly shape our roadmap and guide us in developing new features that resonate with our users. Your feedback is essential in our quest to deliver a delightful user experience and amplify social good.

download on the app store (https://www.spave.io/e3t/Ctc/5E+113/d13J5v04/VX00Bl8vQXGvF5NbCDDv0wKW6D6W6y5cvqVmN2qdv107lxC-W5BWSxg6lZ3p_V59zCP635JYdVtCm2r3qfJvjN57XBGJJPJT-N3Mkr5jz1r62W3SmKLq6BwXwJMZ7zy3svbnVW7v5h9T1K0vP4N76qkVL4lXWkW5K3QJr4SZmq8W92s-qd1V8WkDW5FCZ_K74nGrxW7s6S5G6Mv1j4W31JjCt1Jnf6_W3vPXZc3QP3TxW79jf5J4bBrczW3v5QkP59c9c0N3SbYjY3cQ_JW645g-j4TFm0rW385HRp8Qv5K3W1lh5cH3cHn_fW1-wH5-5D6-SrW8j2h9H8QL_cRW3WDf231DgYLbW8Kp_Zw2T347TN6BzhFgwVHhFW3lQg-s1q7hFCW89YQnl1sqpjHW7g8FSt6vLPSDW8vfHbM6333LvN6n5-6bgFff-W7C1ldq3-3HNkW3dFswr2FZf7CW4cLY5G6b9C3JW1HjVDs7B_yFVN1WSHNFs2lTKW7pXw7Q5KLN9kN49pvX2Ss22zW5sgNHx7Xb9WkV1BzYB7lwmPFW3pKVsl6g__4jV1gWRP4lpB0yN5pw0NG8VxbyW6yYrqL6v49RmV5kxRh8xLj1yW5GBFQ43S1HCLVFxWGM7-jM4sW2T2F_V4-6rXSVWq7Jh8HL3HmW5N_0LB68S-JmN5lqBDM5j8Xdf4tw31604 )

get it on google play (https://www.spave.io/e3t/Ctc/5E+113/d13J5v04/VX00Bl8vQXGvF5NbCDDv0wKW6D6W6y5cvqVmN2qdv1C7lxC-W6N2kFb6lZ3mYW322bhM8SkTyjN2l8gwG-SG80W55s4k_3-TTv3W7-zFpz6zk2fMW1r-vNk5Hpr3nW1KC0qb6q3_9lW2TXSPK3gDLTMV2DYSb1M1cD_W6V27ty5VpgtPN6tKXHP-L-LqW77NwFW2rqqLwW3YgPbR59wWp7W5cPxLZ812H_QN7fWwYr-mmY0W4WfvGg95NN36W2v_vY02ypDwlW6BL7Cp8BbQBKW7v0jp45bFFyMW4M28tv2s5CcRW7xy3vZ4dlM_mW92lG2S9jBmqVW4WlJgW8vwKwtW8wVWd54n6LbVW28f0MX7Qq1NqW4NY2qY9b0xW1W3DgcW52z07VDW8VlRj374tFRkW5NYHj06mjc85W2_Ztn2735KMxW38yj_l2_Q2YyVnD9T62wp59bW5ysdfj8fj7ZXW590GNm76vSzXTzln17y-8DBW7yM6K_7nW2CNW5WwD5Z4DJKLLW4SFbGN1N4GNsN8KKsJc52_dbW1nsTkG8q66ztW8FZ4J_8VXJC8N5Y6tmJZw7DtW3vy5xK1t_Q8MW5x4zJx8cZxSRW5LKVhZ5dgH3FW8BfgF68h6pJ6W3GH0Xx49gm2qW8FJv4q5mbXzhW7LFDV82c6PB8W5D2SP85-2Rz2W2SG4Hz6ZSQhJW24Npwc5S1SBrW2sQ2GT8X6HFKW3ZM3MY7h4Dp5W54NtQx7FKcpvf4R-hxx04 )

After you download and register, don't hesitate to connect with our User Delight Team at support@spave.io to share your experience with us. Thank you for being a part of our journey. Together, we'll continue to transform spending for good.

Amplifying social giving with you,

Susan Langer

Founder/CEO

Spave (https://www.spave.io/e3t/Ctc/5E+113/d13J5v04/VX00Bl8vQXGvF5NbCDDv0wKW6D6W6y5cvqVmN2qdv1j3prCCW69sMD-6lZ3mCW3zr27S2Gj4hYW2LS6n848TlrZW4b12Kh7wTKw_N7wXqPLPprBKN23dhBpKMdb3W1G3L783HzC8-W4Kz75K7K-x2TW806Z_41_7V17W7V3SjZ6N3C7GN4Wk11n9wVwBVlgmXQ87D5mrW6VXSxs8LDzFWW79rdJ66TKP-MW3flCbs3xyLqbVh2rHV3hVRNwW116pdV6r_rsdW6_fF5H4M8JCYW6QJgQV6xZZWDW6hh5Yy1DbPGmW8pHX4C8MdD95f5Bz5tK04 )

emails.subject: Re: UChicago | Applications for Beams' Summer Internships
emails.snippet: Hi Chiara, Please contact to Avery Metzcar as well, we can consider Cedric for EiR (he applied to both roles) and have Avery for Data Science position. If those are not replying Aidan Grogan could be
emails.body:
Hi Chiara,

Please contact to Avery Metzcar as well, we can consider Cedric for EiR (he applied to both roles) and have Avery for Data Science position.

If those are not replying Aidan Grogan could be an option (then we would go like Cedric EiR, Marcus Data Science, Aidan Product). Most candidates applied for multiple roles I am sure we can shift them if needed.

Thanks for your support,
Mihri Minaz
co-founder @usebeams.com <https://usebeams.com/>
+49 176 82234394

> On Apr 4, 2024, at 04:19, Chiara Montanari <chiaram@uchicago.edu> wrote:
> 
> Dear Mihri,
>  
> Quick updated: 
>  
> Kevin decided to accept the offer from a different startup. I’m sending out the offer to Mia, but I’d like to get another name from you, as both Mia and Grace might already have plans for the summer.
>  
> I can also reopen the position if you’d like.
>  
> Thanks so much!
> Chiara
>  
> Chiara Montanari, PhD
> Senior Associate Director, International Careers
> Career Advancement | University of Chicago Center in Paris
> chiaram@uchicago.edu <mailto:chiaram@uchicago.edu>
> https://careeradvancement.uchicago.edu/
>  
> From: Chiara Montanari 
> Sent: Wednesday, April 3, 2024 12:57 PM
> To: Mihri Minaz <mihri@usebeams.com>
> Cc: Verrome Rosbach <verrome@founderland.org>; Jana Schellong <jana@usebeams.com>
> Subject: RE: UChicago | Applications for Beams' Summer Internships
>  
> Dear Mihri,
>  
> Thank you very much for sharing! I’ve extended your offer to the students you listed as first choices and asked them to let me know their decision by Friday.
>  
> According to my records, your backup choices for the Entrepreneur In Residence position already have summer jobs, while Kevin has received offers from other organizations as well. In order to expedite the process, I was wondering if you could share another name for that specific position.
>  
> If you prefer, I’d also be happy to re-open it – many students who were not applying for jobs a few weeks ago, are doing so now.
>  
> Thanks so much!
> Chiara
>  
> Chiara Montanari, PhD
> Senior Associate Director, International Careers
> Career Advancement | University of Chicago Center in Paris
> chiaram@uchicago.edu <mailto:chiaram@uchicago.edu>
> https://careeradvancement.uchicago.edu/
>  
> From: Mihri Minaz <mihri@usebeams.com <mailto:mihri@usebeams.com>>
> Sent: Tuesday, April 2, 2024 11:20 PM
> To: Chiara Montanari <chiaram@uchicago.edu <mailto:chiaram@uchicago.edu>>
> Cc: Verrome Rosbach <verrome@founderland.org <mailto:verrome@founderland.org>>; Jana Schellong <jana@usebeams.com <mailto:jana@usebeams.com>>
> Subject: Re: UChicago | Applications for Beams' Summer Internships
>  
> Hi Chiara,
>  
> We conducted interviews and made decisions for each position:
>  
> Entrepreneur in Residence - 1 Person
> Kevin Gugelmann
> Backup: 1. Mia Rojas 2. Grace Lu
>  
> Product - 2 People (1 in-person, 1 remote)
> Marcus Chandra
> Benjamin Heim (he will fully be remote so no accommodation and flight costs)
>  
> Backup of Marcus: Aidan Grogan
>  
> Data Science - 1 Person
> Cedric Haddad 
> Backup: Avery Metzcar
> ———
>  
> Unfortunately backups Mia, Grace and Avery didn't reply back to our emails yet.
>  
> Looking forward to,
> Mihri Minaz
> co-founder @usebeams.com <https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/usebeams.com/__;!!BpyFHLRN4TMTrA!_mNebbsy94q--LWP6h6XaLxxa1MaAcyO3bUgS8nmtC_KXw5hD4z_ZY7AQm0kfvG2pwgC2Gg4pXfPSNDR$>
> +49 176 82234394
>  
> 
> On Mar 22, 2024, at 11:14, Chiara Montanari <chiaram@uchicago.edu <mailto:chiaram@uchicago.edu>> wrote:
>  
> Hi Mihri,
>  
> My understanding from Veromme was that Beams would be ok to cover the flight for an intern for each position.
>  
> If this is not possible, I would then consider hire the second and third intern – or any additional one from the group of students highlighted. Those students have merit scholarships that they received for their summer quarters, and do not require any additional budget. 
>  
> I’m also happy to connect over Zoom and discuss further, either now, or once you know how many candidates you’d like to bring on board.
>  
> Thanks so much!
> Chiara
>  
> Chiara Montanari, PhD
> Senior Associate Director, International Careers
> Career Advancement | University of Chicago Center in Paris
> chiaram@uchicago.edu <mailto:chiaram@uchicago.edu>
> https://careeradvancement.uchicago.edu/
>  
> From: Mihri Minaz <mihri@usebeams.com <mailto:mihri@usebeams.com>> 
> Sent: Friday, March 22, 2024 6:51 PM
> To: Chiara Montanari <chiaram@uchicago.edu <mailto:chiaram@uchicago.edu>>
> Cc: Verrome Rosbach <verrome@founderland.org <mailto:verrome@founderland.org>>; Jana Schellong <jana@usebeams.com <mailto:jana@usebeams.com>>
> Subject: Re: UChicago | Applications for Beams' Summer Internships
>  
> Hi Chiara,
>  
> Great news, so happy for this opportunity! 
> We would like to get 2 or 3 interns. Does this mean we would cover the flights only for 1 intern?
>  
> We will review and contact the interns within coming week!
>  
> Best,
> Mihri Minaz
> co-founder @usebeams.com <https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/usebeams.com/__;!!BpyFHLRN4TMTrA!_l2s657jhK9G6U3CueapcG-EKCX17iMz_mSewhwy4__zByIUwzmdNC2bm2lgLkgnknK-xpVbDM1WLyhQ$>
> +49 176 82234394
> 
> 
> 
> On Mar 20, 2024, at 02:15, Chiara Montanari <chiaram@uchicago.edu <mailto:chiaram@uchicago.edu>> wrote:
>  
> Dear Mihri,
>  
> Greetings from the University of Chicago’s career service office!
>  
> I collaborate closely with Founderland's team to facilitate UChicago student placements within its partner organizations.
>  
> I’m happy to share that we received a very high number of applications for all the three positions we posted for Beams – see the attachments!
>  
> If at all possible, I’d like to ask you to follow the timeline below – of course if you need a few more days at any point, no worries at all!
>  
> Review material and contact candidates to interview by Thursday, March 28
> Hold interviews by April 5th
> Inform me of hiring decision by April 8
> I’ll then communicate with the candidates and give them a few days to decide
> Please also share the names of 1 or 2 alternative candidates, in case your first choice decline the offer.
>  
> As agreed, University of Chicago will provide a $4000 scholarship to one intern for each position and Beams will cover the flights.
>  
> If you’d like to bring on board a second intern, I’d like to highlight a group of students who have already received a scholarship for their summer and would not need additional funding from the University and Beams. Please note that if you choose one of them as the only student, we will still ask you to fund their travel expenses.
>  
> Product Management Intern:
> Alejandra Sarmiento
> Avah Harris
> Kevin Zamudio
>  
> Data Science Intern:
> Alan Hernandez
> Alejandra Sarmiento
> Avery Metzcar
> David Agyei
> Gabe True
> Hady Aly

emails.subject: How to own your day (4 Time Management Methods)
emails.snippet: "What is important is seldom urgent, and what is urgent is seldom important." – Dwight D. Eisenhower What to do Own your day with 4 time management methods. Why it works US President Dwight D
emails.body:
View this post on the web at https://beyondproductivity.substack.com/p/how-to-own-your-day-4-time-management

"What is important is seldom urgent, and what is urgent is seldom important."
– Dwight D. Eisenhower
What to do
Own your day with 4 time management methods.
Why it works
U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower (pictured above) rose to fame as a superb leader and strategist during World War II. As the Supreme Commander of the Allied Expeditionary Force, he oversaw the planning and execution of Operation Overlord, the Allied invasion of Normandy on June 6, 1944. Famously known as D-Day, this invasion marked a turning point in the war and led to the liberation of Western Europe from Nazi occupation.
Besides his leadership, Eisenhower was also known for his exceptional ability to manage his time and priorities. During his presidency from 1953 to 1961, he faced many responsibilities, ranging from domestic issues to international affairs. Throughout his long career, he was deliberate about distinguishing between what’s truly important and merely urgent. He excelled at remaining focused on the most significant, important tasks while not succumbing to the pressures of the immediate, urgent ones.
As his example shows, the key to time management is balancing urgent and important work. If you want to own your day, you need to decide which tasks are urgent, which tasks are important, and when (not) to do specific tasks. Here are 4 time management methods to pull this off and own your day — plus a handy cheat sheet.
How to do it
Eisenhower Matrix. Created by Eisenhower himself (and popularized in Stephen Covey’s book “The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People”), this is arguably the best tool for determining what’s urgent, important, both or neither. After classifying all your tasks accordingly, start with those in the “Do” quadrant (see cheat sheet below). Then, move on to the “Schedule” quadrant. Only then work on the lower quadrants (the “Delegate” and “Eliminate” ones). Learn more about using the Eisenhower Matrix here [ https://substack.com/redirect/8309c453-8a7c-420b-9a03-35d61d7130ca?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ].
Eat the Frog. Popularized by Marc Twain, this is a great way to make progress on hard and important tasks (e.g. deep work). It’s dead simple: do your most important, hardest work first thing in the morning. If you’re among the 25% of people with a late chronotype (aka “night owls”), do it later in the day instead. If you want to learn more about determining your chronotype and timing deep work accordingly, check out this article [ https://substack.com/redirect/1046ede0-1efe-409c-ad19-69d4982b4c40?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ].
Pomodoro. Use Francesco Cirillo's popular method to complete hard and urgent tasks (e.g., email). Here’s how: Focus for 25 minutes and then take a 5-minute break. Repeat four times, then take a longer break. While Cirillo’s method is helpful for shorter tasks, it’s far from ideal for challenging deep work that requires extended focus. That’s why I use an altered version of that method — the Pomodoro 2.0. Learn more about the Pomodoro 2.0 here [ https://substack.com/redirect/11859fe2-8804-4e38-9f2d-498bb31acee2?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ].
Timeboxing. Popularized by Nir Eyal in his book “Indistractable”, this is the best method I’m aware of to decide when (not) to do specific urgent or important tasks throughout your day. Here’s how to use it: Start by grouping similar tasks together and put them on your calendar (see cheat sheet below). As you go through your day, stick to the schedule whenever possible, and adapt it if necessary. If you want to delve deeper into timeboxing, read this article [ https://substack.com/redirect/8a64117c-52a6-4f0e-b89a-6c05cb5d8fc2?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ].
Try these 4 time management methods to own your day – and follow me on LinkedIn  [ https://substack.com/redirect/69db21ad-e983-4427-86a4-5e5c3ae5d0ad?j=eyJ1IjoiMThvNDE4In0.NISaA8T6ox_siOrBkiztHE1EMvrX0M2w6DvyJjK2MQc ]for daily tips and more cheat sheets on habits, productivity and personal development 
Lastly, please share this post with one person who might benefit from doing so, too.
Until next week,
Christian
2 more ways I can help you
1) 1-on-1 Coaching Program
Do you struggle with focusing on the important work while jumping from one urgent task to the next? Do you feel tired in the morning and throughout the day despite sleeping for 7 or 8 hours at night? Do you have trouble dealing with high stress at work and “switching it off” at home?
If so, my new Becoming Ultraproductive 1-on-1 coaching program might help. In it, I help executives, entrepreneurs and CEOs build rock-solid habit systems for deep focus, deep sleep, and mastering stress — to increase their productivity by between 100% and 900% while making stress work for them instead of against them.
The 1-on-1 coaching program includes six sessions over 12 weeks. If you’re interested, learn more about the program and get in touch below – or simply reply to this email.
2) Executive Search
I’m also a partner at Poensgen Digital, an executive search boutique my wife founded in 2021. We specialize in helping clients find executives for the most important positions in the digital age.
Against this background, we focus on four areas: management consulting, corporate, venture capital, and private equity. From our past searches for leading European companies in each of these areas, we built an extensive network of 10,000+ high-potentials with 2-30 years of work experience.
If you’re interested in learning more, follow the link below to get in touch – or simply reply to this email.

Unsubscribe https://substack..8A5ganZAn9_Kqjg_KXS_nVqdQV_SyEWfnMrSkYGywoE?

emails.subject: April admin update
emails.snippet: Slack April 2024 Slack Admin Updates Read on to prepare yourselves and your members for new capabilities, changes and deprecations. WHAT'S NEW What's new or currently rolling out: Channel
emails.body:
Slack

 





 


 

 
 

 



  


https://click.email.slackhq.com/?qs=ca8b92b4d5ed46ac3f18f6e3723dacb0d36d689d59298afb8a4beecf86e662818f4c6a127528b17f34d20ddb95b7aada00561a0230669027 


April 2024
 

Slack Admin Updates
 

Read on to prepare yourselves and your members for new capabilities, changes and deprecations.
 

WHAT'S NEW
What’s new or currently rolling out:

  

Channel manager enhancements (Enterprise Grid)

Channel managers have the option to restrict who can archive and post in channels.


https://click.email.slackhq.com/?qs=661b87f1052629a4449e57a2997c86c93e285012a73310e0ee6a08e3db82282cc26d90d1800a9d66b37c5422976ba1fe7b35c26dc16eccd1c6163c13cf57df7d 
Learn more ‌  →

  

GIF picker in the message composer

Members will be able to attach GIFs to their messages using a new picker inside the Slack message composer. This feature will be controlled by a new setting in workspace/organization Settings.


https://click.email.slackhq.com/?qs=661b87f1052629a4937f19732e546a2c5a51fa293625f90ea242dc9178b64b2190a13d101296d22c9f82986d3c8315efc842e609356b89d75c4b870700c5d7d4 
Learn more ‌  →

  

New canvas shortcut

Members can quickly insert objects and change formatting by using the slash (/) command in a canvas.


https://click.email.slackhq.com/?qs=661b87f1052629a497783767732c1ce9be0d9ee0e78313b07ed812cbb3608a5405e115b53780aebf62628a503cda525aff3f00224e6cdb1beb779f02d7983193 
Learn more ‌  →

  

ACH bank debits payment method

Teams in the U.S. and Canada have the option to use ACH bank debits as a payment method within the checkout page.


https://click.email.slackhq.com/?qs=661b87f1052629a4783119af9c8c5af4572847db2538889745a0b6d8320eab32ec3ec71bbb67f193702cdb32fb0b1dacf7f8507aaf9d8657a307374722647ac0 
Learn more ‌  →


COMING SOON
 

  

Native Slack DLP (Enterprise Grid)

Organizations will be able to reduce the risk of sharing confidential or personally identifiable information within Slack. Primary owners and DLP admins can enable preconfigured rules or create regex-based rules that quarantine messages and send alerts, allowing admins to manage violations and members to edit their message.



 
 

  

Monthly active user data

The overview dashboard will soon display data showing monthly active users, the number of people who have read or sent a message in at least one channel or direct message at least once in the past 28 days within a given workspace. Enterprise Grid organizations will also be able to access this data at the org level.



 
 

  

Visibility into channel canvas edits

Members will have the option to share canvas updates within the channel. Channel members will see a message indicating that changes have been made to the canvas.



 
 

  

Channel manager invitation restrictions (Enterprise Grid)

Channel managers will be able to restrict members and guests from inviting others to private channels, making it so that only channel managers and admins will be able to invite users to the channel.



 
 

  

Canvas analytics dashboard (Enterprise Grid)

Owners, admins, and members with permission will have access to a new analytics dashboard that gives insights into how many canvases are created, viewed, edited, and commented on over time.



 
 

  

Shareable celebrations

Members will have the option to celebrate their coworkers by sharing their work anniversaries or recent new-hire status to channels.



 
 

Upcoming deprecations

  

OS, app and browser versions reaching end of support on March 1, 2024

In accordance with our support lifecycle policy, we have discontinued support for a number of operating systems, app versions and browsers.


https://click.email.slackhq.com/?qs=661b87f1052629a44c1e3cc505e72963ee3745d70320ad161d7e41329e5b76a9ac1c2733307e131cda26d4ce7f257a911171a3b2dc025f90a28da5be999ab333 
Learn more ‌  →

Legacy configurations will be deprecated on September 1, 2024

With the introduction of a streamlined desktop app configuration, the following legacy configurations are redundant and will be deprecated.
	- Slack default sign-in on all platforms. See default-sign-in-file
	- Environment variable SLACK_NO_AUTO_UPDATES on Mac and Windows
	- The user preference SlackNoAutoUpdates on Mac. See disable-automatic-updates

 
 


 


https://click.email.slackhq.com/?qs=661b87f1052629a4f3f22845dcfd6661ccc51c2d59af2a464e52aa2f6882428616311860e1de7bc545ab93704d2a8efec7faa62c51ab8df0a9bce0a8e8c51100 
HELP CENTER 


 

 


 
 
https://click.email.slackhq.com/?qs=ca8b92b4d5ed46acf0834a081b6da12c21e54ea2a3fd7a0e5e17dd1e6e41d4c97cc6d1a284a900558ff9a4654e9fd4b0a4ead883060152d8

emails.subject: Download new e-book: Monitoring Modern Infrastructure
emails.snippet: Understanding and monitoring dynamic modern infrastructure Logo Hi Mihri, IT infrastructure has changed drastically due to the rapid emergence of the cloud. With organizations moving to hybrid and
emails.body:
Understanding and monitoring dynamic modern infrastructure

https://tech.us5.list-manage.com/track/click?u=5dbbd5506e9e02fda04cd81da&id=068acd2ea2&e=5c6e83ca66
https://tech.us5.list-manage.com/track/click?u=5dbbd5506e9e02fda04cd81da&id=ea40beb878&e=5c6e83ca66

Hi Mihri,

IT infrastructure has changed drastically due to the rapid emergence
of the cloud. With organizations moving to hybrid and dynamic cloud
infrastructures, monitoring environments has become increasingly
complex.

Understanding dynamic and complex infrastructure, and applying
the appropriate monitoring tools and methods can be challenging.
Experienced reseller partners can help streamline product procurement
as well as provide thorough vetting of industry-leading technologies in this
new era of dynamic cloud infrastructure.

Datadog has created the eBook, Monitoring Modern Infrastructure, to

emails.subject: Applied Bioplastics Wins the Startup of the Year Fast-Pitch at SXSW
emails.snippet: SBIR Road Tour, Somewhat Frank, UFOs, and more View this email in your browser Established logo with stars two men on stage in front of a crowd of people Applied Bioplastics for the Win Congratulations
emails.body:
SBIR Road Tour, Somewhat Frank, UFOs, and more

View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/est/22124-9252753?e=e7210711ef)
https://www.established.us
https://www.appliedbioplastics.com/


** Applied Bioplastics for the Win
------------------------------------------------------------

Congratulations to Applied Bioplastics (https://www.appliedbioplastics.com/) for winning the Startup of the Year® Fast-Pitch Competition at the Established® House during SXSW® 2024!

The Austin startup competed against nine other early-stage innovators with a three-minute pitch. The company captivated the judges with its work supplying economically sustainable plant-based plastic alternatives (https://www.appliedbioplastics.com/) . Applied Bioplastics reduces pollution and petroleum dependency - and supports eco-friendly agriculture in developing countries.

This big win means the company takes one of the semifinalist spots to compete for the next Startup of the Year® at our Summit this fall. Stay tuned for details!
https://www.americasseedfund.us/2024-road-tour-south


** SBIR/STTR Road Tour South Is Happening This Week
------------------------------------------------------------

As part of Established’s innovation work (https://house.established.us/) with the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA), we produce America’s Seed Fund Road Tour (https://www.americasseedfund.us/road-tour) . Road Tour is a national effort to connect entrepreneurs to non-dilutive, technology funding opportunities provided through the SBA’s Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) and Small Business Technology Transfer (STTR) programs.

This week, from April 2 to April 5, the Road Tour team and over twenty federal agency representatives will travel by bus and stop in four southern states.

Road Tour: South (https://www.americasseedfund.us/2024-road-tour-south)

April 2 | Little Rock, Arkansas

April 3 | Jackson, Mississippi

April 4 | Baton Rouge, Louisiana

April 5 | Houston, Texas

Following this tour are Road Tour: Southeast and Road Tour: Great Lakes. Check out which stop is nearest to you (https://www.americasseedfund.us/road-tour) , and register to attend!

APPLICATION DEADLINES
* Rolling | Startup of the Year Community (https://established.us5.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4d7fca2b16284f9a6e9881d73&id=a511c75243&e=a1d550e97e)
* May 1 | Startup of the Year Summit (https://summit.startupofyear.com/)
* Rolling | Bunker Labs Breaking Barriers Cohort (https://bunkerlabs.org/breaking-barriers/?vgo_ee=50BbrezKAfPwCClvjK89vfnAORK8oEzdhwTR8f2Y%3AZksNkLA8%2BUGdZj9sdD%2BkrraYZ1plYboU)
* Rolling | Sequoia Open Source Fellowship (https://sequoiacap.com/oss)
* April 10 | Forum Ventures and Canva Developer Fund Pitch (https://theorcanetwork.com/opportunity/639?utm_source=Visible+Hands&utm_campaign=5e995793a9-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2022_01_27_09_45_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_945b13e51d-5e995793a9-551522948)
* April 22 | Y Combinator Summer Accelerator (https://www.ycombinator.com/apply)
* April 26 | Peerless Pitch 2024 (https://mlt.smapply.org/prog/peerless_pitch_2024/)
* May 6 | Black Ambition Prize (https://blackambitionprize.com/)

UPCOMING EVENTS

* July 15 - 19 | Road Tour: Great Lakes (https://www.americasseedfund.us/2024-road-tour-great-lakes)

https://est.us/j3j


** Why Humility Is So Important to Startup Success
------------------------------------------------------------

Our long-time partner, Embarc Collective (https://embarccollective.com/) , celebrates their 5th Anniversary and was recently featured in Inc (https://est.us/j3j) . for their stellar work and success as an accelerator in Tampa, Florida.

Established worked with Lakshmi Shenoy, Embarc’s CEO, in 2018 when she founded the organization, and we partnered with them for our 2021 Startup of the Year® Summit. Seeing how their portfolio has grown from 25 startups to over 125 companies is fantastic.

Enjoy the full article (https://www.inc.com/sydney-sladovnik/why-humility-is-so-important-to-startup-success-according-to-this-accelerator-hub.html) to:
* Hear how Embarc excels at its role
* Understand the value of mentorship
* Learn the characteristics of Embarc’s successful founders

Congratulations, Embarc!
READ (https://www.inc.com/sydney-sladovnik/why-humility-is-so-important-to-startup-success-according-to-this-accelerator-hub.html)

** UFOs and the Search for Alien Life
------------------------------------------------------------

On thishttp://somewhat.frankgruber.me/0052-pulitzer-prize-finalist-and-bestselling-author-garrett-graff-discusses-his-thoughts-on-ufos-and-the-search-for-alien-lifeSomewhat Frank Podcast, (http://somewhat.frankgruber.me/0052-pulitzer-prize-finalist-and-bestselling-author-garrett-graff-discusses-his-thoughts-on-ufos-and-the-search-for-alien-life) the team connects with Pulitzer Prize Finalist and current Director of the Cyber Initiative at the Aspen Institute Garrett Graff (https://www.garrettgraff.com) to discuss his new book, UFO: The Inside Story of the U.S. Government’s Search for Alien Life Here - and Out There.

Don’t miss this fascinating interview! Here are some hints about what’s inside:
* How the conversation has changed on the Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena (UAP), formerly known as a Unidentified Flying Object (UFO)
* Various layers of Government disclosure — what is and is not shared with the public
* Where and how technology and innovation is involved
* What a future alien message might entail (http://somewhat.frankgruber.me/0052-pulitzer-prize-finalist-and-bestselling-author-garrett-graff-discusses-his-thoughts-on-ufos-and-the-search-for-alien-life)
* And more!

emails.subject: how do startups actually get sold? 🤔
emails.snippet: You know what's funny about starting a company? Even at the beginning, you're often asked about how you plan to end it. It takes a village to raise a startup 👶 Startups are nothing without a
emails.body:
You know what’s funny about starting a company? Even at the beginning, you're often asked about how you plan to end it.

It takes a village to raise a startup 👶

Startups are nothing without a strong, supportive community behind them, pushing them to the finish line.

Founders understand this, as no single founder can raise the capital needed, complete all of the necessary work and see their idea through to fruition without supportive friends, family and colleagues.

Singapore Global Network (SGN) (https://d2Mzlx04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/2O+113/d2Mzlx04/MXd-Xk3XyD_W4dfymn1bsRbRW8LzBkh5cv0htN5bb0hH3lcq-W6N1vHY6lZ3kHW7pMtHf1CshVqW1gD52c8Z06PTW443X0w1Wt4lGW4z0cKH8X1GtWW44FWLR8QQZvwW9cgN6R3MjJ0TN4ZNwWypdz8SW3nJ9S02LlbwXW4pN9Vj3CyXSkN514sqLJKYQ0W48CR_78h0trHW8cDSVD1QKjQyW6cJHx67MSVF_W2RSKlL2nYrycW5RzwMp9lvCx2W1DpsR04DJdCQW61GMnf22NBpMW36WtwW8HCBY3W6DT1ch6pzs0JW1pWyn07b6_ZYW1jznP12zvr0lVk9RW34FwPs-f8BNGjR04 )  understands this, too.

As a division under Singapore’s Economic Development Board, SGN broadens and deepens Singapore’s networks of family, friends and fans, by building meaningful and lasting professional relationships across the globe.

Whether you are Singaporean, a friend who has worked or lived in Singapore or simply interested in discovering the vibrant opportunities the “Lion City” has to offer, SGN invites you to check out its 123,000-strong (and growing) network of global professionals, founders and friends.

Join SGN today! (https://d2Mzlx04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/2O+113/d2Mzlx04/MXd-Xk3XyD_W4dfymn1bsRbRW8LzBkh5cv0htN5bb0hH3lcq-W6N1vHY6lZ3n3W270Chf563RLmW1YnMHH4VcHySW7qmgwK3--1D0VlFY4095WCqxW9dB1KV5W5_0qW6s916s6wzSVnW73Z-fc4gV-lRW4czBtG2P7htFN4qWrY9HM0jpW6qFf9s6YBWpgW4J4dd_6l7Ms-W775zmS13p0kMW6XwMN-1pCCzKW1FvDNB1FR41NW6ddj6G66LfSJW4ZbQJL32KrfGW8lKG2N5zdf88W2gvVrH7hqyMYN7HcqqJGbQ0LW8dk5598BLTTqW7BGfrQ3kQtdJW7rRpHf43bbpFd1X48s04 )

*this is a sponsored (https://d2Mzlx04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/2O+113/d2Mzlx04/MXd-Xk3XyD_W4dfymn1bsRbRW8LzBkh5cv0htN5bb0hH3lcq-W6N1vHY6lZ3p1W1sP75N1CJy4hN18zwCY_ltQsW8PXdFl2c-yPWW7dq-v91WYPtvW8QdJ9d6PNBLHW1CQLL12_ZmWgN6jggkw_N7mXN5L45d6D1ZmyW3xYXmK7TR0sqN2NnC94hCm6jW8rDvmJ7WXhg4W8sXD668MMZvyW3t5nny3Z5GJ0W4RJyTD7Xy1GRW7DQXKD8BDCwgN7K_ZWkNy20GW4LsH7K78ksvVW4gGsLY4mdQFDW51QjLJ5704GxW4Fp4WM53hlfnW35s7qC7cPK3pW6XL7Ll90jcnDf8PcKcT04 ) post

You know what’s funny about starting a company? Even as you are just beginning – assembling a team, searching for funding, building out your product – you are often asked to think about ending it.

“Nice idea, but what’s your exit?”

Elizabeth Yin had a lengthy conversation (https://d2Mzlx04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/2O+113/d2Mzlx04/MXd-Xk3XyD_W4dfymn1bsRbRW8LzBkh5cv0htN5bb0jz3lcq-W8wLKSR6lZ3lGW8x70G844r-7hW3vvQKS5ZYsqGW82Y33N3wCZgCW15MGv17f_zjTW7tbMj42sqV5wW95my8j94CR1wW2GXFfm7nH2ptW3T_qbf2qZKcLW5nTbqb4b_qCGW8QP-TB2PQLYHMYHKTJCmF2VN8ZJ2YmWFB0_V_hGfS5hnBL5W5f0st22vrxzbW3_6npH4kL6VZW7XDgPb5Z6ZgcW3qS6K01j7bqyVGdGd14hxlvgW52w_DD4tSP8VN8ZVLbjCWTMRW346PD08MLJTDW4l5KJR3CX1tRW7hWsm34xgfKbW24Pbdp7CmFCPW5T_LPt5d_h6sN1sksgX50km5W5YsN743qZLknW7J05cz1V6v0Rf6m2zHj04 )  about this topic (among others) with Andrew Gadzecki (https://d2Mzlx04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/2O+113/d2Mzlx04/MXd-Xk3XyD_W4dfymn1bsRbRW8LzBkh5cv0htN5bb0hH3lcq-W6N1vHY6lZ3lmW9kMMmH54LgPdW3SRM0P53WK_2W13hk_81MTPd3W5y3TWJ9j1xB8W8wFfK_3RCHYRW38__TP6hJ4nvW39xJTQ5TCSc0W1xLpW844TwYVW3jStdT30JWsRN26RtxtXkJNlW518Kmb5yQswsW7hc9X67k3wLdW9453Sb7r6G7YW8fvHDV2fqPYvW4cFydH2fy1XgW7wPY0_3vVmqDW1Fw-rx4dKMgYW4xfl3M4W-G0dW5NsyMf21c2_JW5-zZSf7cHTYyW69-fNL8CCqtmW9dn5kd5Ntx_Rf7RXYMj04 ) in 2023. Andrew Gazdecki is the founder of Acquire.com, an online marketplace for buying and selling startups. He’s also gone through the process of selling his own startups more than once, so he is actually the perfect person to answer the big question:

How are startups bought and sold?

Well, one of the first myths that Gazdecki is quick to dispel is the idea (hope?) that buyers just materialize when you need them. Instead, getting acquired is much like getting funding or making sales – you need to find potential buyers and funnel them through your process in order to give yourself the best chance for success on the best terms.

So let’s say you’ve identified a few potential buyers and are getting that process started. What do the steps tend to look like?

Kick Off

The kick off call is usually a high-level, getting to know each other session – both personally and professionally. Personally, you want to show that you’re open to the ideas of others, easy to work with, and able to answer questions honestly, without getting defensive.

On the business side, you want them to know what your company does and some possibilities for where it could go.

Gazdecki is quick to note getting acquired requires a certain amount of goodwill between the parties.Things crop up along the way – requests for updated or brand new metrics, the VP of Strategic Partnerships getting replaced midway through the process, etc – this is where having a relationship of mutual respect helps you weather anything that may arise going forward.

Documentation, including a deal timeline.

Documentation in this case includes things like a Confidential Information Memorandum (CIM), your financial statements, and due diligence documents. This is where you get into the details of things like go-to-market strategy, customer acquisition and retention plans, company and growth data, and everything else that makes your business tick.

Creating a timeline establishes when certain milestones will be hit – for example, when you’ll provide your financial documents or when the buyer will provide a letter of intent (LOI). Having this timeline keeps everyone involved accountable.

Evaluate offers

Part of the reason timelines are so helpful is because they funnel buyers into getting you what you really want – multiple offers. Multiple offers means you have leverage to negotiate. As you look at offers, evaluate them not just by the number of the purchase price, but also by the details of the purchase. Look at cash vs. stock, what earn-out periods look like, if there are any conditional hold-backs or other clauses that might not work for you and your company.

Sign the final paperwork and complete your sale

Congratulations! You’ve just sold your first company.

Want more?

Elizabeth and Andrew dove deep into the whole process behind getting acquired. Setting yourself up for success early on, finding potential buyers, positioning your company, negotiating the deal, and more.

Highly recommend watching it here (https://d2Mzlx04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/2O+113/d2Mzlx04/MXd-Xk3XyD_W4dfymn1bsRbRW8LzBkh5cv0htN5bb0jg3pyd0W7Y8-PT6lZ3pgVJg2qd7J3HyCW67Lstr54Y_13W39W8C72x3TKkW7xnYcd2vvxPgW8-pF5h94C4yhW7YwMrc4WRb8cW8N9kzP24LKYjW44vHwk3X1s9tW6TSpg84SYRpZVMygHk7ZjbdjW3lLW751rFs6_W6pW9ln5Y4Z3_W73r3bW1ZWG9vVTM1SH2Rc1QhW6j0p483zn1jwW4rhF1Z442hZWW2Z536y1hGJT5W6ht1xZ7Gj_MfW7XD5fC39RR4xW6T7FpB1kFFKQVJdylP5HzND7W4h8VMD2QD6Z4W3p3HW17L6KQCW1n_RM67yW0zpW1_nDZK3TMvgHW8frxq87vFDTHf8YkMvR04 ) .

Cheers,

Carolyn

This article was written by Carolyn Abram, a freelance writer with a passion for technology. She also writes fiction and teaches writing classes in her home of Seattle. You can learn more about her at her website (https://d2Mzlx04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/2O+113/d2Mzlx04/MXd-Xk3XyD_W4dfymn1bsRbRW8LzBkh5cv0htN5bb0hn3lcq-W69sMD-6lZ3pPW6RVJfT2q43MLN3p4pyn7V95nW3zqfkq336C_4W2_4nhS1C1nRNW7l-y7M17Z8y7W8Q_5GM5372C1W3gKbxW2P7FQ3V6S_Nq5d_tX2W18hFrg8YXYzlW7fdts-93NRSzVcmJzm53csclW6SKqzc2Y001qN5ln3xft29YpN68996vng39pN1R0Jpx1rnHGW4-vW6g3Yy47mVqvK8z9dWHSmW7GkG9s8xRpmmN2vsC5DrRL7-W5t90rp6s-kkzf4qq8rq04 )  or on LinkedIn (https://d2Mzlx04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/2O+113/d2Mzlx04/MXd-Xk3XyD_W4dfymn1bsRbRW8LzBkh5cv0htN5bb0hH3lcq-W6N1vHY6lZ3mvW5nBmr355HN4RW4RFqfl8khND8W7C6Dcv5fq6BVW8_xFjl11Qp7qW2KltTB5w_f4DW6q6yG41GNTnTV-N9jR57JdQQN5jmCw8pzC1MW3R_s3z4hGNhCW7wsTBN4NfwsxW5KnZW71KM5Y8W5mLC658GCvVlW28JS609j2NmsW2dg9rb2QkY_CW8-dJ8h34bpbVW6sMvgG94CCb_W5SHVgl3ZC2BHW7FzDsx1h64H3W1_YR-57MxFf9W2Nqv7g4tQBmjW6hwWwx6r-f42W7gwNmQ5x6K98f4MKT2d04 ) .

65f30d9d40810060ecce551d_cohort analysis (1) (https://d2Mzlx04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/2O+113/d2Mzlx04/MXd-Xk3XyD_W4dfymn1bsRbRW8LzBkh5cv0htN5bb0jT3lcq-W95jsWP6lZ3nqN4WDyF_Fmzl6W68YWDw71syw1W2pZyGZ4KTl_4W43wVtf7Vv-cNW1GjCnc4wR56CW5MQYl92Mss6LW4_Wgxy3Dgg0LW1Bg9-R6wbs2tW40S32Y7whDysW5S02gg1HhT6KW39MF-p4plKpkVS1npw1Lm63-W1JxSf53FBvTnW6kMqjV4G1_2jW81GXgr112TvhN7PJ92hyL6PYW1Q_Sm02TD4rQV2njGg4h-nfyW2ktSpM7Wv9D1W47F2p18QzmwZW5fWnkj5zWwpwW4wZFnm4M_18tW1HYdV-8gcd5SW1zZ_75169CW0W6L6nSb5gT5qWW70hG7y2Jd3Y5W24hztb49n2LYW4R89R141CsQnW7YFH7j94TzZ8W1pzj1K6tl7kKf16dQnx04 )

How can early-stage startups benefit from cohort analysis?

The data itself will be specific to your business. But the sorting of data is something every startup should learn how to do – and do well.

emails.subject: Last Chance to Register for Venture Summit West
emails.snippet: A quick reminder that TODAY is your last chance to pre-register for Venture Summit West 160 VCs \ 190 Startup presenters Venture Summit Last Chance to pre-register and Save $200 is TODAY at midnight.
emails.body:
A quick reminder that TODAY is your last chance to pre-register for Venture Summit West

160 VCs \ 190 Startup presenters \ Venture Summit

Last Chance to pre-register and Save $200 is TODAY at midnight.

Email topimageWEEK 15 (https://c3pYq04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/LT+113/c3pYq04/MX70k8sNGyBVjR42091RhXbVkMXxJ5ct-kcN89-QzT3pyd0W6N1vHY6lZ3mHW3HzdMR5dN0jRW3hj0cV2kPrM5W3y-mSS8TFgYRW78Qfrk1RrzYTW3t2XP_6wc3bhW51fnyx875q6BW1mCdjN6XTG0rW3z_zdV7KRLFYN213X_MfPvDqW4tRLhB4Z1DfnW1KVr2M5YZ_N6W4CmgFt7gPD4WW7DNMlk8ZnbvmN3g99VdlS-P1N2j0ksNsbr0BVnhpLQ33Cv3cW849mmJ7MT2QlW2H73xV5-DBsWW3wqbQH8Z4RsTW98LxLc3TKyglW6p1Bhq53LTsSW3SXZHz6GVNF_f3tw8N204 )

Don't Miss Out

Mihri,

A quick reminder that TODAY is your last chance to pre-register for Venture Summit \ West being held on April 9th & 10th in Silicon Valley.

Join over 1,500 VCs, Corporate VCs, Angels, Investment Bankers, and founders of venture-backed, emerging, and early-stage companies registered to attend.

Whether you're a startup seeking capital or an investor seeking new deals, Venture Summit West is one event of the year you won't want to miss!

FEATURING:

Venture Panels, One-on-One Networking, Startup workshops, Investor Presentations

MONEY // OVER 160 EARLY-STAGE INVESTORS

Discover what industries they favor, what they are looking for in their next investment, and what you must do to get them excited.

DEALS // MORE THAN 190 TOP INNOVATORS

More than 190 venture backed, emerging, and early-stage companies will present on April 9th & 10th . This is your chance to connect with an audience of leading founders, venture capitalists, corporate investors, angel investors, investment bankers, and strategic partners.

MATCHMAKING //  ONE-ON-ONE NETWORKING

Venture Summit is the perfect place to efficiently meet, interact, and network One-on-One with your future investors and partners utilizing an industry-leading built-in video meeting platform.

SECURE YOUR SPOT (1) (https://c3pYq04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/LT+113/c3pYq04/MX70k8sNGyBVjR42091RhXbVkMXxJ5ct-kcN89-QBM3pyd0W8wLKSR6lZ3l6W4pJ9F55h8ly6W7jWLFw4NsKNHW7Fz3XT8-b4x1VyTZGF5s8JQxW7HX7LF1NPb2VW7YYDDd98sL1tW44Tv4H3sbYxVW7cgnzp7ZR9mvW1NhcCy4fzvDPW2Qcs2j45ksrXV2Q0p15wtdfLW4BqNzG7-sMwvW16Wh6233xLH5V1D-tz9dHb2-W4yHyt464twlSW4jRT8c9lFmHlW1pYjj02dgS6CW7H0z9z1yxNS4W5mScdS7fRY_BW7CmlYJ1bgD6LW1jK75k1K8vPpW73Z80f4cx8r0W375rTj1NXqkYW1tmm8L64jNxgW24rnPW6ryRn4VzBKrS5W-RdcW6tkNtf6K9TsfW5nSTfH1T5N0tf2X5gQT04 )
